270 produits enregistrés

133 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
10
Recommandé
14.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2022
Bugsnax
The best way to describe Bugsnax would be to describe it as a passion project with true creative control over it. Utilizing ideas from established franchises such as Ape Escape and Pokemon Snap, and creating an imaginative brand new puzzle-adventure creature collector game, with fun visuals and a great soundtrack. To top it off Bugsnax even manages to tackle a lot of serious subjects through its story and entertaining characters incredibly well.

Visuals
Visually the game is nothing but charming and whimsical. From the areas you roam throughout the play-through to the creature designs wandering around, everything screams fun and imagination. It is overall quite simplistic looking but the developers know that and use it to their advantage when creating props and models which allows them to give everything personality and make it unique.

Like who sits down and looks at a burger and thinks GREAT that is our little burger beetle AND actually makes it an iconic creature. That's just one of the bugsnax even, there are hundreds of them and a majority of them are incredibly well designed and showcase their food element wonderfully! Young Horses character design team genuinely did a splendid job on the bugsnax themselves and overall everything but especially the bugsnaxs. It really drives home the creature collecting aspect of the game, as you want to see and get every bugsnax out there on the island.

Soundtrack
Audibly the game sounds incredibly amusing and pleasing on all fronts. The characters' voice actors play heavily into the quirks of the character that they are portraying which creates memorable characters and make them all fit into their roles in the story. Then there is also the bugsnax themselves! They simply shout their name much like Pokemon would making it fun exploring and finding random bugsnaxs and hearing their cries. Or just perhaps listening to Bunger all day. Because Bunger.

The soundtrack is backed by Seth Parker who previously also was the composer for Octodad, who is back again with another great soundtrack. He manages to make every piece feel so weird yet comforting at the same time which creates this hard-to-describe aura when combined with the underlying messages and story of Bugsnax and I could not applaud him enough for that. It manages to make you feel at ease and then within minutes then that comfy feeling vanishes and you suddenly feel uncomfortable and it somehow switches seamlessly between these emotions. There is also a track from Kero Kero Bonito which is probably the catchiest ending credits song that they could've been made for Bugsnax.

Controls
The controls are very straightforward, you have an arsenal of traps and tools you use to trick and cratch bugsnax with. These can be accessed through the weapon wheel where you can select or destroy already established traps to get them back. To get a hint of how to catch/defeat the bugsnax you're facing you can use your camera to scan them to see what they hate and love. Besides that, you essentially just run and jump around interacting with the grumpuses, bugsnax, and the world solving puzzles along the way in the areas to catch the specific bugsnax you're trying to catch for whatever reason. There is the occasional "boss fight" which requires a different type of play style to defeat and is a joy to do. Sadly there are just not many of them, but the ones that there are were great.

Every trap feels unique and creatively designed. The only thing that bugged me about them was some of the traps just were not utilized as much as they could have been or simply not introduced well enough leaving out some strategies that by the time you realize that you could do it, it is too late and you already had to do it a less fun way to whatever you were doing. But overall they still felt fun to fiddle with and never became tedious to do.

Story
The story boils down to you a journalist who has been invited to the Snaktook Island by Elizabert Megafin to interview her. She wants to discover all of the different types of bugsnax on the island. Once you arrive on the island something flies into your airship and the ship crashes but luckily you find Filbo. You then learn that he was out trying to find Elizabert as she had vanished which caused all chaos amongst the villagers on the island and everyone went off to live by themselves rather than in the town. It is now up to you to figure out what happened to Elizabert and where she is, reason with everyone and get them back to the town, and figure out what a bugsnax really is? Is it kinda bug and kinda snack or is there more to it? such as what happens when you eat them?

Which honestly does not sound like anything new that has not been done before. But where Bugsnax truly shines is how you go about unraveling that story. you slowly find the 13 grumpuses that live on the island and ask them to come back to the town, they initially refuse but you help them with different things involving bugsnax, which help them decide whether or not to come back.

but while all of that happens each character opens up to you and it tackles some deep and serious subjects such as depression, loneliness, relationships and loss, simply working together on a community level, and many more. These topics are done well in regards to their approach and execution so it never becomes too much as the humor manages to keep the dialogue for the most part light-hearted throughout. These moments just feel so incredibly genuine and well done alongside the things you find around the island such as the recordings showcasing Eggabell's relationship with Elizabert.

Do not let the cutesy and charming visuals drive you away from the game, it has a great story where the journey is incredibly fun and well-paced with plenty of puzzles and characters along the way. As I mentioned it does sound like it has been done many times but Bugsnax truly manages to make it unique, hence why I called it a passion project with the creative freedom to express everything the way they wanted it to be.


Additonal Note(s):
Alongside the Steam launch for Bugsnax Young Hourses included a free expansion "The Isle of BIGsnax" which offers roughly 6-8 additional hours of content on top of the base 8-11 hours of base game content with new creatures, features, and areas to explore alongside some of the grumpuses. This takes place right before the ending arc, and if you already completed the game you should be able to press continue to return before the last big moment and start the expansion.

Final Thoughts
Bugsnax is a genuine treat to play and is almost as addicting as the bugsnax themselves. It is mechanically simplistic but catching bugsnax and scanning them is immensely fun and does not get boring. The story wise it is much deeper and more creative than initially thought to be. Visually the game could not be more whimsical and cute, with fun creature designs, and the soundtrack is just as wonderful with many tracks that you can just vibe to and overall a sound design that is satisfying to listen to. Overall great purchase, and highly reccomend playing it!

Click here for more Reviews - also follow my Curator Page if you want more recommendations.
 
Kidomaro

Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2022
Don't let the 2.8 hours fool you: I played this game on a previous platform so much I spent a week becoming the 69th fastest speedrunner.

No, really. I freaking love Bugsnax.

Gaming would be a heck of a field if more developers got to just make goofy projects for the sake of making something weird and cool. A world in which muppet-like beings discover an island full of creatures that're edible bug puns is not one for gritty AAA post-irony. It's contained, it's weird, it has a creeping sense of dread with how okay with everything the Grumpus camp seems to be.

You got weird body horror in a cartoony world. You got amazing writing. You got absolutely committed vocal performances that 100% sell every second of the way.

There will be puzzles that feel like absolute luck to solve. There might even be characters you simply do not enjoy and suffer through/skip dialog scenes starring them. All of it is worth the ride that is Bugsnax.

It may not be as industry-changing as Portal, but Bugsnax is absolutely a rare instance of a game that's like Portal in that it is wholly itself and makes no apologies for that. You collect edible creatures like Pokemon while attempting to uncover the dark secret of their island. Also there's canon gay and nonbinary characters where that fact is simply background to who they are.
 
Gender Gobblin'

Recommandé
12.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2022
Bugsnax defies every expectation put on it.
You take one look at Bugsnax and you expect the absolute worst from it. And why wouldn’t you? It’s 202x and children’s entertainment is more annoying than ever. You’d think Bugsnax would be another one of those filler games only meant to milk money off kids. Just another kiddy game filled with bad writing and dull mechanics. And I honestly wouldn’t blame you, as it’s something that everyone has thought about this game. But Bugsnax isn’t part of this garbage children’s entertainment junk, it is so much better than that. I wanted to play Bugsnax the moment I heard it far exceeded others’ expectations and I’m hoping you will too.

From a gameplay perspective, Bugsnax is fairly simple on the surface. It’s a first-person adventure game with a heavy focus on creature capturing. There are little over a hundred of the little critters to capture and while they do repeat some of the solutions, they used quite a few creative ways to figure out how to capture them. You’ll be setting traps and baiting Bugsnax into them in a large variety of ways. A big portion of this comes from the number of tools you have and having to combine them for certain captures. One example that comes to mind has to deal with capturing bugs that are frozen or on fire. You could lead them into a fire or pond with some bait, but you could also knock another Bugsnax into them and capture them both at the same time. The gameplay doesn’t just revolve around capturing insects though. The game’s quests mix things up enough to prevent the capturing from getting old. Some of my personal favorite sidequests involved spying on certain characters and others had me dressing up the characters in a specific fashion. That’s another big part of the game. Feeding a character a Bugsnax causes part of their body to become that Bugsnax. This resulted in the grossest game of dress-up that I ever found myself enjoying. I made one dude entirely out of popsicles and I made his wife entirely into pickles. There are also 5 optional bosses to fight, although 1 is part of the free DLC. The bosses all bring their own unique puzzle to solve to beat them and I’m glad they’re there as sort of a final test for the game’s simple gameplay loop.I found myself enjoying the quests, catching, and dressing up enough that I 100% the game. And there wasn’t a single dull moment.
Bugsnax has a large variety of little critters to capture. 
Une capture d'écran de Bugsnax
Par : Clumbernut

Bugsnax allows for the most nightmare-inducing dress-up game I've played. 
Une capture d'écran de Bugsnax
Par : Clumbernut

But the gameplay isn’t even the biggest selling factor for me. One of the strongest points of Bugsnax is, surprisingly, the writing. The characters may all look like discount Muppets, but the game’s cast is one of the most human ones I’ve seen in a video game in a long time. Let alone for a kid’s game. Bugsnax may have a cutesy exterior, but that never stops it from dipping its toes into more mature topics. One of my favorite examples would have to be Triffany’s questline. Her plotline revolves entirely around her obsession with leaving an impact on the world before she dies. Other characters delve into issues like depression, abandonment issues, and severe anxiety. Considering the kid-friendly aesthetic, this may sound jarring, but I promise you the game handles it well enough that it never feels out of place. And the more adult themes never stop the game from having a sense of humor. I think my favorite joke has to be that one of the characters keeps a cactus replica of his wife because he gets lonely sometimes. That and the absurd names like Gramble Gigglefunny and Wiggle Wigglebottom. I mentioned earlier that the lack of repetition helped me do all the sidequests, but seeing the conclusion to everyone’s arcs helped with that as well.
The cast of Bugsnax is filled with characters with sad back stories. They're not the most depressing, but certainly worse than you'd expect. 
Une capture d'écran de Bugsnax
Par : Clumbernut

I don’t think the characters would’ve been such a selling point to me without the voice actors though. Bugsnax has a shocking catalog of incredibly talented voice actors. Just take a look at the backgrounds of some of them, you’re bound to see someone you recognize. Roger Craig Smith and Yuri Lowenthal are the big standouts to me. They’re the voices of Sonic the Hedgehog and ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Ben 10 respectively. All of the voice actors are really good is the point I was trying to get at. One quick look at some of their resumes is a quick way to prove it and I applaud Bugsnax for putting effort into its voice acting.

My biggest complaint about Bugsnax may seem incredibly nitpicky, but I promise it’s not minor. The world map may cover a decent amount of biomes, but they’re all so enclosed and tiny. Every area is so small that a quick stroll throughout the island results in dozens of loading screens. I really feel like both the beach areas, desert areas, mountain areas, etc. could’ve been put together as one area. I don’t want the game to become open-world, but the number of loading screens between areas gets pretty tiring. I can imagine it’s going to be more of a problem for lower-end PCs. I just feel like the PS5 launch title could’ve gotten a little more intense with the map size. That and I feel like biomes get a little repetitive. As I mentioned earlier, half of the biomes just feel like an extension of the previous one. And it’s a little disappointing that the final area of the game is effectively a straight line.

As some quick round-up points on my thoughts on the game: the soundtrack is pretty good. I don’t think I’ll be listening to it outside of the game too much, but the interview theme is an exception to that. A lot of the creature design is pretty cute and creative with the constant blending of bugs and snacks. I found the pineapple tarantula, hot dog worms, and sandwich centipedes to be a few of the pun names that stuck with me. I can not say the same for the Grumpus design. I just really don’t like the way the default characters look. Like I glossed over in the introduction, they look like discount Muppets. Oh and as a final positive note, I really appreciate the free DLC campaign. Too many game companies lock additional content behind a paywall and I always have to applaud companies that choose otherwise.

Overall, I greatly enjoyed my 12 hours with Bugsnax. I completed every sidequest and the free DLC in that time and it never got repetitive. I highly recommend it and I’m giving it an 8/10. I’m hoping to see more like this and less like Octodad from Young Horses in the future. For $25 it is definitely worth the price.
 
Clumbernut

23.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2022
Quite literally one of the best games I've ever played. It's such a fun game with creative art direction and characters you genuinely care about. Even the characters that your supposed to hate are likeable, it's incredibly hard for me to dislike any of them even if they sometimes do some very morally questionable things. Not to mention the absolutely stellar voice work across the board, it really brings the world of Bugsnax alive and, again, helps a lot with making these characters likeable and easy to root for.
Gameplay-wise, this game is super fun. I've already completed this game a few times over on my PS4 and I have a blast every time, especially when I discover a new way to catch a bugsnak I hadn't previously discovered in other playthroughs. The new update that came along with the Steam launch adds to the fun factor for me, with so many new optional quests giving me the opportunity to discover new hidden secrets and gameplay elements I would have never discovered otherwise. I particularly found the missions that came along with a certain doctor's letters to be very very entertaining. Nothing quite like the experience of intentionally putting your character in dangerous (and realistically speaking, very very deadly) situations just so you can get some new furniture for your hut.
Without spoiling too much, the plot twist is hinted at very effectively, yet somehow caught me completely off guard my first time through. After replaying it a few times, I really began to notice that the plot twist has always been implied and hinted at from the very beginning, and yet it's done in such a clever way that it isn't super obvious immediately. This adds a lot to the replayability, seeing how many hints you can pick up on that you missed on your first time around.

So yeah, great game all around. I feel absolutely no regrets purchasing this game 3 times as well as purchasing the Bunger plush literally the second it was up for sale. Bunger my beloved.

63.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 octobre 2022
Bugsnax has become one of my favorite games of all time.
at first I thought it was just some fun silly adventure, and I did get that too! catching the critters was extremely fun, especially experimenting with ways to catch them, and stepping into a new biome to scan everything in sight was a wonderful feeling!
the game went much deeper though than I thought. sure there are some body horror elements and a few adult jokes kids wouldn't catch, plus the ending and all... but the characters are full of depth, they're so well written and even if you think the game couldn't make you like a certain character or two, it will once you complete their sidequests.
i absolutely adored the bigsnax update too (which wasn't an update for me but integrated into the main game beautifully, I wouldn't have known if not for the internet that it was free dlc)! the new place, new lore, interactions between characters and much more! I adore being able to find hats and put them on the little creatures, and the mail system is an absolute treat! it really adds more depth and character, not to mention the hut customisabily that really makes you feel like part of the town.
this game captured my heart completely. it's got so much love poured into it and it's just an amazing experience overall! thank you, Young Horses ♥! I'm looking forward to seeing more of your heart and creativity in the future, be it Bugsnax related or otherwise!

7.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2023
Literally unplayable. This game is full of bugs, but also snacks, so I feel like that balances out the bugs.

BUNGER? BUNGER BUNGER BUNGER BUNGER BUNGER BUNGER

This is the game that caused the infamous Cyberpunk delay. CD Projekt Red really didn't want the smoke, and tbh I don't blame them.

Bugsnax is amazing. I fell in love with it so fast. The characters are so well written. And I still quote 'I'ma lift your crib, dawg' weekly. It has this weird dark vibe under all the cuteness that is just unsettling. It’s like the child friendly version of the film Annihilation. Bugsnax is not what it looks like on the surface.

Going into this game I expected a kids Pokemon like game. I got that, but a s**t ton more. I got to meet super memorable characters all with their own personality and relationships with one another. The game has some of the most brutally honest dialogue, its amazing writing and delivery. Cute, silly, great voice acting and a surprisingly kid-friendly introduction to the wholesome world of body horror. I tried it out for its premise, but I stayed for the surprisingly deep characters.

Once the characters start getting into their discussions, you learn it is in fact a decently mature story with elements of mental health problems, relationship dynamics and complications, as well as introspective analysis of the main characters and how they behave/respond to those around them.

The whole vibe is also just amazing. Super eerie which I was very surprised about with the whole mystery feel going on which I loved. From the very beginning of the game you start to speculate and realize things are not what they seem and you start to understand there’s a lot more depth to it. There’s just such a sense of mystery and a slight unease that I hadn't felt from a game in a very long time. Amazing soundtrack as well.

The game may look very simple, but they did a lot with it, from fully physics-based creature states to fire and ice gameplay mechanics as well as top-tier quest-tracking/management UI.

Each bugsnax is such a treat to discover and learn about and every single one is voice-acted, and though they can only say their name, they didn't just settle on 1 recording of it, all Bugsnax have 3 or so variations of saying their name so it never really gets monotonous or annoying, and each actor is bringing something unique to their performance which keeps it fun and adds a lot of personality to each creature.

Also, the ending may be on of the biggest reveals and best endings in recent memory. I’m not spoiling but it is definitely something I believe everyone should experience for themselves. I seriously was moved to tears when it ended. You just can't even imagine how well the game gets to its end.

Seeing how some your actions have consequences for the ending is great and offers some replayability to see how characters change and react differently depending on your choices. Game is literally the definition of not judging a book by its cover.

People laugh at it but I would recommend it to anyone.

10/10
 
Flavius Claudius Julianus

Brendyn YojimBev
272 produits enregistrés
0
42 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
17.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2022
《Bugsnax》是一款轻松有趣，但又不如表面上看上去那么简单欢快的“生物收集”类（Creature Collecter）游戏。

本作第一次亮相貌似是在PS5的发布会上，由于这款游戏的画风看上去和其它展出的游戏格格不入，之后貌似出现了小范围的玩梗热潮。但在玩梗和调侃的背后，本作的质量其实是没有任何讽刺含义的优秀，它没有止于奇怪滑稽的外表或对某些成功作品的模仿，而是真正做出了独特的东西。在之后我会更详细地介绍本作的玩法和叙事深度。

在那之前，关于本作大概是一款什么样的游戏，这里有一些基本的解释：

第一个，什么是“生物收集”类游戏？这方面最有代表性的肯定就是《精灵宝可梦》（或者很多人可能更熟悉的《神奇宝贝》）了，是指核心游戏玩法是不断捕捉不同的生物的游戏。不过《精灵宝可梦》系列的核心玩法除了捕捉还有战斗，两者基本密不可分，而本作则没有一般意义上的“战斗”系统，而选择完全在“捕捉”玩法上下功夫。

其次，关于本作可能的一个中文译名“虫子快餐店”，我可以说，本作和什么“店”一丁点关系都没有。本作从始至终就和“开店”和“模拟经营”不沾边，英文标题“Bugsnax”仅仅是本作中一种生物的名称，感觉翻译成“零食虫”还算比较合适，不知道怎么翻译出来“店”的意思的。

然后，本作商店页面的“心理恐怖”标签是怎么回事？由于我对“心理恐怖”这个标签也没什么理解，不知道到底有什么样的关键要素才算“心理恐怖”而又不是“恐怖”，这里只说我的感受：这个游戏确实有一定“心理恐怖”元素，不过集中在整个游戏的结局（大约一个小时左右），起码在画面表现上完全没有血腥或过于恶心的地方，也没有让我感受到太多的恐惧，但我能理解有人会对这些内容感到不舒服。而在本作的其他部分，也是绝大多数部分，本作最多算比较奇怪，也有一些暗示剧情走向的伏笔，但除此之外还是非常纯良的。有关本作的“心理恐怖”的作用和具体涉及什么样的内容，我之后也会详细说。

把这些解释清楚了，就可以介绍本作了。

剧情和玩法简介

先总结一下本作剧情的开头，因为这样之后介绍玩法时就可以更好理解。

主角（你）是一个记者，你收到探险家Elizabert的邀请，前往岛屿Snaktooth Island。她声称她在那里发现了Bugsnax，一种集合了虫子（Bug）和零食（Snacks）特征的珍奇生物（材质上都是零食，只是形状类似虫子，怕虫子的可以不用那么害怕）。它们不仅布满了这座岛屿，而且它们有一个最显著的特点——非常地好吃。感到了制造一个大新闻的良机的你立刻动身，准备采访Elizabert，当然也有一部分原因是，如果你再不整点正常的新闻，你的工作就要没了。

然而，在来到岛上之后，你发现Elizabert在你来之前已经失踪了，而Elizabert带来岛上的一批岛民也在Elizabert离开后，由于各种原因而分崩离析，比起集中住在搭建好的小镇里，他们都选择独自跑去岛上的某个地方居住。只有“代理市长”Filbo还心存希望，在发现你有捕捉Bugsnax的天赋之后，Filbo希望你可以代替Elizabert的位置，通过捕捉Bugsnax和其它支持，把岛民们召回小镇，如果能找到Elizabert，就更好了。

这样这个游戏的目标就很清晰了，而达成目标的方法，也就是本作的核心玩法，“捕捉Bugsnax”。本作中有100种以上的Bugsnax供你捕捉，但大多数时候，捕捉它们并不是那么容易。最简单的情况下，你只需要观察Bugsnax的移动轨迹，并预先放置陷阱，然后再走远，等它走进去即可远程收起陷阱，捉到Bugsnax。但之后，不同种类Bugsnax的不同习性就让捕捉的过程远远没有这么简单了。有的Bugsnax只能在被弄晕后捕捉，有的Bugsnax会避开特定种类的陷阱，有的Bugsnax具有攻击性，有的Bugsnax就单纯处在一些陷阱无法轻易到达的尴尬位置......这就需要你综合考虑它们的习性，手上多种捕捉工具的作用，以及周围的环境和其它Bugsnax，并制定一套捕捉计划。可以说，寻找能够捕捉某一种Bugsnax的方法，就是一种“解谜”。

不过说是这么说，但捕捉Bugsnax这种“解谜”并不像我玩过的很多解谜游戏一样，每个“谜题”都仅有一个固定的解法。虽然有的时候是会有一些更方便的方法，但更多时候，本作中的“谜题”就和现实中很多问题一样，合理的解决方法是很多的。你可以利用Bugsnax的习性，利用捕捉工具，利用环境，利用其它Bugsnax，或者利用这些的任意组合，可以说，本作给了玩家充分的自由，来让玩家想出属于自己的解决方法。

游戏内容

整个游戏的舞台Snaktooth Island被分为若干不同的区域，这些区域会随着游戏进行逐步解锁。除了这种阶段性之外，你可以认为本作是一个“开放世界”，具有多条不同任务线（对应不同岛民的请求），和一旦解锁就会完全开放的多个区域。每个区域都会有新的环境和十几种新的Bugsnax，这自然也就意味着新的挑战。

让每个岛民回到小镇的任务线是流程必须完成的“主要任务线”，这些任务通常会引导玩家理解一些新的机制，并要求捕捉一些相对简单的Bugsnax。不过说是“引导”，对我的口味来说，可能还是太直接了一点。本作可是以角色之口说出了好多“谜题”的解法，并不只是“提示”的程度，就是直接说出来了。虽然我个人觉得可以把引导做得更隐式一点，把难度稍微提高一些，但考虑到这种画风能够引来的受众，也可以理解吧。

而除此之外，每个岛民也都对应一条“支线任务线”。这些任务就不是完成结局必需的了，在这个阶段，游戏的难度在我看来就比较合适了，虽然有提示，但没有到把着玩家的手一步步去做的程度。玩法上，这些任务通常也要求玩家捕捉一些相对更难的Bugsnax，通常需要更加有创意的解法。甚至，在一些支线任务线的结尾，玩家还要面对在游戏其它部分中不曾面对过的挑战：传奇Bugsnax。这实在是让我十分惊喜，我之前说过，本作没有一般意义上的战斗系统，甚至连血条这种生命限制都没有，但在捕捉传奇Bugsnax的过程中，我虽然手上做的还是布置捕捉工具的那一些事，但却真的玩出了一种“战斗”的感觉。这个部分绝对是本作的点睛之笔，既产生了类似动作游戏的刺激感，也没有为了动作而舍弃了偏解谜的核心玩法，甚至反过来更进一步探索了核心玩法的深度，实在是妙。

叙事上，玩家可以通过完成这些任务，更深刻地了解这些角色，这里真的要说一句，我一开始没想到本作会有什么有意义的叙事成分，就算有，我也实在想象不出能用这些看上去非常滑稽的奇怪角色讲出什么严肃的故事。但这个游戏的这些支线任务打完，好多故事是真的能让我产生共鸣的。这些角色来到这座岛上都有各自的追求，并希望Bugsnax能一劳永逸地解决自己的问题，但他们真正的问题通常都在于不能真正地认清自我，这使得他们的追求最终转化为了执念。连和自己都不能和解，和他人自然也充满了矛盾，这也是他们一开始分裂到岛上各处的一个重要原因。经过了他们的任务线，虽然他们并没有直接大彻大悟，产生180度的转变，但他们都更深地认识了他们自己，这样的“寻找自我”的故事对我来说，可以是最普通的故事，但也可以是最真实、最有感染力的故事。

以上就是本作本体的绝大部分内容了。本作在上Steam后应该自动包含了一个DLC的内容，还是可以很明显地看出来哪个部分是DLC的，毕竟对应的任务被放在“Extra”一栏。DLC中包含一个全新的大型区域，比本体中任何区域都大，包含一整条全新的任务线，中间还会分裂成多条并行的任务线，但是角色还是一些老角色。玩法上，加入了11种新的Bugsnax，以及新的机制，这些新的Bugsnax都需要使用这种新机制，配合本体中的多种捕捉工具，才能捉到，我感觉比本体要更有挑战性。DLC的结尾也有一个传奇Bugsnax，设计的比本体中的所有的都要复杂，很不错。

叙事上，这个DLC也更深入地探索了本体中较少着墨的一些角色之间的关系，在共同经历了一段别开生面的旅程之后，他们都更清楚地认识了自己和彼此，不管是本体中就让我非常喜欢的角色，还是一些一开始很讨人厌的角色，都获得了属于他们自己的“角色成长”。我感觉DLC的叙事是本体叙事方向上的一个自然的延展，主题都是“寻找自我”，而DLC的主题要更加偏向“认识自己的不足和他人的价值”这一点，而DLC通过看上去完全不可能合得来的若干角色之间的交互，来实现对这一主题的诠释，结果在我看来是很成功的。

DLC还加入了一种新的额外“任务”，即岛民们会以邮件的形式提出各种各样的“请求”。这个就是单纯地添加内容而已了，没有叙事成分，任务完成奖励也只是一些装饰品而已，不过任务本身还是很有意思的，有很多很有意思的要求，比如需要按描述来猜岛民需要哪种Bugsnax，或者要求拍摄Bugsnax在具有某种状态、做某些动作时的样子，或者需要到地图中某个犄角旮旯捡岛民丢失的东西，等等。这些请求应该也是本作最难完成的任务了，它们进一步探索了游戏机制，对玩家的游戏理解做出了更高的要求，可以看成额外的“谜题”。总之是一个很好的补充。

心理恐怖

点评了本作的玩法和叙事，最终我们还是避不开这个明晃晃的“心理恐怖”标签。它指的到底是什么？本作的结局到底发生了什么？在这里我不会在黑条之外的部分剧透具体的剧情，我只简单说一下我对这个部分的看法。

我感觉，就这个展开而言，其实大多数人在游玩的时候应该已经有想法了，有关Elizabert失踪的原因，以及Bugsnax乃至整个Snaktooth Island的本质，只不过碍于这个游戏极度纯真的外表，实在是不敢相信会往那个方向走而已。一开始我认为，本作“恐怖”的部分只能说是开发者想做恐怖而做的，不是非常必要，但确实是一种很强的视听刺激，我也能理解，直到我更深刻地理解了整个游戏的象征含义，以及发现了“坏结局”的存在。

如果你没有完成本作的所有支线任务（和角色有关的那些），你是有可能达成坏结局的，在坏结局中，角色会因为没有战胜Bugsnax而真的死亡。而无论是好结局还是坏结局，都在原有的主题上引入了另一层意义：人不能依赖某种外物来解决自己的问题。Bugsnax就是那种外物，而这可能是毒品的象征，这是一些网友的想法，我觉得还挺有道理的，我很认同。在坏结局中，本作的这种象征意义会体现得更加明显一些，只不过是以一种非常伤感的方式，而考虑到坏结局的存在，最终我认为本作的“恐怖”部分很好地强调了玩家选择的重要性，从而增强了本作的叙事效果，突出了主题。

如果你实在想知道本作的恐怖具体涉及什么内容，那就请看下面用黑条盖住的部分，显然，会对结局造成一定剧透：结局时，会有一个虽然画面表现上都是各种各样的食物和Bugsnax，但本质上是代表了“身体恐怖”（Body Horror）的巨大怪物。不涉及追逐战，也不是那么恐怖，但有可能看着有点恶心。还有类似“丧尸入侵”一样的展开，但画面表现上仍然只是各种食物和Bugsnax。最终还轻微涉及了“秘密组织”这样的阴谋论恐怖，如果你把这种有点细思极恐的东西也叫恐怖的话。

除此之外，DLC应该增加了一个新的隐藏地点，完成这些内容会看到一些隐藏剧情和一个隐藏结局。也不算隐藏结局吧，就是结局后的对话会有改变，也是阴谋论的方向。呃，挺有意思的，逻辑上也合理，但如果没有后续的话，我觉得还是和没有没什么区别。聊胜于无吧。

总结

总的来说，本作是一款很有创意的解谜冒险游戏，核心玩法的设计和探索都十分不错，各种Bugsnax的设计很有意思，叙事上也能引发共鸣，结局更是能给人留下深刻印象。如果可以的话，请不要因为本作看似滑稽的外表而漏过本作。

结论：强烈推荐。
 
OldCaptainWZJ

5
Recommandé
19.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2022
Bunger is Goated

Damn what a breath of fresh air this game was, Bugsnax is a really unique experience that i'd encourage anyone vaguely interested to give this game a try. It's difficult to explain what exactly the game is but i would say the main features and gameplay elements are capturing critters, exploring the world and helping the members of your town.

The story is well told while not disrupting gameflow, i'm not a story focused gamer but i found myself caring about my town and some of the characters in it to the point where i wanted to do all the side content and requests.
The town slowly builds up as you progress and it's cool to see the transformation, not to mention you have your own house to customize which while not super in depth is simple and fun as a side distraction.

The world of Bugsnax is just really engaging and i found myself thinking about the game when i was away, wanting to find out what i had ahead of me next play session, it just has that quality that well designed games have. The vibrant yet ominous world just keeps you coming back for more in between hunting for snax. The mechanics of capturing the snax is fun for the most part, if i had any criticism i'd say some of them can be frustrating to catch, but it's not a big deal and is never enough to ruin the experience.

Had a great time with this one and i don't want to write too much because it's better to be experienced first hand, but once again i must reiterate Bunger is Goated.
 
Coldrestia

Recommandé
10.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 avril 2022
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2 the game!

While on the outside, the game looks light-hearted and cute with the way the people are designed and the creatures are given googly eyes. However, talking with NPCs,
the game tackles more mature topics like marriage problems and mid-life crises.

The main mechanic/objective of the game is to catch Bugsnax, each requiring different strategies and tools. As you progress through the game, your repertoire of tools becomes more vast and thus the strategies required to catch Bugsnax becomes more complex.

The controls for both controllers and keyboard and mouse works out well with keybinding also being an option. There is an option to make run while viewing other windows or not.

There are some things that would be nice to have but, there are arguments to be made that these features aren't really needed. Skippable cutscenes would have been nice but, there are very few cutscenes that exist. A detailed map of each area would be nice but, the areas are compact enough that one can argue that it isn't needed.

TL:DR

The game has light-hearted atmosphere while also tackling heavier relationship problems.
Use various tools and strategies to catch all the Bugsnaks.

Bunger/10 would eat again
 
Monty Fisto

Bugsnax is a family friendly candy coloured adventure game about depression, featuring heavy doses of body horror. The general flow of the game is figuring out how to capture bugs that look like various snacks, and then feeding them to the friendly muppet monster people to mutate their bodies.

Évaluation publiée le 14 mai 2022
Two part review. First part is for a potential buyer/player and the second is for the Dev team as I don't know how else to communicate these things to them.

To a buyer/player. Don't hesitate. This is a game made with love and care. From performance to enjoyment. Stable and runs well, characters are more human where it counts than anything their outsides could ever make you think at first. The art style is welcoming and imaginative. Plenty to do and creative game-play.

To the dev team: This game works and runs well on all the hardware I have tried it on (consoles, PC, M1 Max MacBook) Thank you for taking the time and energy on a very very usable MacOS port AND not putting it in a hard to find spot. Mac development means the world to me and so does this game. I was able to play this game and enjoy it in just a few minutes on my MacBook during my lunch. Best lunch in years. I won't forget this experience. I felt so honored seeing the care and love put into this game in it's own artistic right, but I also felt valued as a customer who is spending money and time. I can tell that you're proud of this, and you should be. Fantastic. Just fantastic.

Évaluation publiée le 19 octobre 2022
As someone who has 100% the game, I recommend this. If you want a cutesy creature-collecting game with characters that somehow make you care so deeply for them and think of them as real people with names such as 'Chandlo Funkbun' and 'Gramble Gigglefunny'.

To add on to more of this review, the critters in this game (the titular Bugsnax) are wonderfully designed and make catching these little guys all the more entertaining. The soundtrack fits the atmosphere of this game very well and so many other factors come together to wrap up this package into a wonderful, delightful game.

advance the rats nest
0
27 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
4
Recommandé
19.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mai 2022
História
Em Bugsnax você é um jornalista que, para evitar sua demissão, parte em uma aventura na ilha Grandsnak com o objetivo de encontrar e entrevistar uma exploradora chamada Elizabert. Chegando na ilha, você se encontra com Filbo, o prefeito da vila criada durante a expedição de Elizabert, após um breve tutorial descobrimos que ela está desaparecida e que os moradores da vila se separaram. O plot do jogo gira em torno disso, fazemos missões para reconstruir a vila e resolver os problemas de seus habitantes, também entrevistamos e coletamos informações sobre a ilha e o possível paradeiro de Elizabert.

O jogo, apesar de fofo, constrói bem (na medida do possível) o mistério em relação ao que aconteceu com Elizabert e a verdade por trás dos Bugsnax. Mesmo sendo bem pé no chão, a história tem seu valor, tendo personagens de personalidade forte e com desenvolvimento adequado.

Gameplay
Bugsnax é um jogo casual, ou seja, as mecânicas dele são bem simples. Os Bugsnax, criaturas que são uma mistura de inseto e lanche, tem várias características que influenciam no processo de captura deles, alguns são grandes e precisam ser "stunados", outros pegam fogo e quebram seus equipamentos e por assim vai. O processo de captura dos Bugsnax é basicamente um mini-puzzle, quase sempre existe mais de uma forma de captura-los, além dos equipamentos, o cenário e até outros Bugsnax podem ser usados na hora da captura.

A gameplay não tem muito segredo, em menos de 30 minutos você vira um mestre na arte de capturar Bugsnax, mesmo sendo simples, o jogo não fica enjoativo graças a sua diversidade de "inimigos" e métodos captura. Além disso, o jogo é curto, então você provavelmente vai zerar antes de ter a chance de enjoar (isso se você não estiver mirando nos 100%).

Vale lembrar que você pode dar os Bugsnax para os grumpus, fazendo com que uma parte do corpo deles vire aquele Bugsnax. Na reta final do jogo a vila vira um show de horrores por conta disso, apesar de não influenciar diretamente na gameplay, é muito engraçado as combinações que da para fazer. Grindei pra fazer o homem picles e não me arrependo, muito...

Minha experiência com o jogo
Admito que comprei o jogo pelo meme, uma vez que ele é todo bisonho, felizmente fui pego de surpresa nessa. O jogo é realmente bem divertido, eu amei a trilha sonora e o estilo "cartoon" do jogo, fazia MUITO tempo que eu não me deparava com um jogo tão criativo quanto o Bugsnax. Além de divertido, a diversidade de criaturas é bizarramente grande e a tradução dos nomes é simplesmente perfeita, tem pérolas como: bichorrasco, fritaranha e besoureo.

Infelizmente esse jogo não é composto exclusivamente de qualidades, existem diversas linhas de texto com a tradução bugada, os loadings são demorados e ocorrem com muita frequência e as mecânicas para enfrentar os chefes deixam a desejar. Além disso, algumas missões acabam sendo repetitivas, te obrigando a pegar um Bugsnax expecífico várias vezes, sem contar que não tem nenhuma forma de filtrar o bestiário, fazendo com que você tenha que revirar ele até encontrar onde fica o Bugsnax que você precisa capturar.

Conclusão
Se fosse para dar uma nota, eu diria que Bugsnax é 8/10. O jogo superou todas as minhas expectativas, a gameplay é divertida, a trilha sonora é incrível, a ambientação e as criaturas são bem diversificados. Você consegue sentir que os devs fizeram o jogo com gosto, LITERALMENTE .

Mal posso esperar pelo Bugsnax 2, definitivamente um jogo apetitoso!!!
 
exleandro
399 produits enregistrés
5
22 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
17.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2022
Horrores ocultos (entre chucherías y terciopelo)
BUGSNAX llegó para "trollear" a aquellos que decidan darle una oportunidad. Puede que engañe su colorida y desenfadada estética, pero la verdadera "chicha" se esconde debajo de numerosas capas de felpa y algodón de azúcar.

En BugSnax nuestra misión es muy simple: un grupo de Grumpus (Muppets) se han mudado a una isla desierta, pero ¡Caramba! resulta estar habitada por unas adorables criaturas llamadas BugSnax, una mezcla entre bicho y "chuche" estilo Pokèmon, que además... están de rechupete. Nuestra misión será acudir a esa isla y hacer un reportaje sobre estas sabrosas criaturas... ¡y hacernos ♥♥♥ todas!.
Vidéo YouTube™: Bugsnax - Announcement Trailer | PS5 
Vues : 1,568,350
"From the minds behind Octodad: Dadliest Catch comes Bugsnax, a whimsical adventure game coming to PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4 holiday 2020.

Conflictos existenciales
Una vez allí descubriremos que los Grumpus no se aguantan entre sí y que sufren todo tipo de trastornos emocionales, mostrando cada uno de ellos una construcción en sus personalidades por encima de la media en este tipo de propuestas. Pero como aquí hemos venido a coleccionar "bichos", nos dedicaremos a fotografiar y a averiguar como capturar a cada uno de ellos (siendo esta la base del gameplay). Y, por qué no, a dárselos de comer a nuestros nuevos amigos de peluche durante sus encargos. Además, cada vez que se coman uno, una parte de su cuerpo se convertirá en dulce ¡qué divertido!
Bugsnax 
Une capture d'écran de Bugsnax
Par : 3dw4rd™

El terror se viste de dulce

Será trascurridas unas horas de juego cuando el trasfondo de la historia nos empezará a dar ligeras pinceladas de que algo turbio hay en el ambiente... Muppets desaparecidos, nuestros amigos de peluche cada vez tienen más dependencia de comer BugSnax y, por lo tanto, sus cuerpos se mostrarán cada vez más trasfigurados. Restos de cadáveres cuyos huesos muestran marcas de dientes sugieren que los anteriores habitantes de la isla prefirieron DEVORARSE VIVOS entre ellos antes que someterse a ser convertidos en un amasijo de "tarta y piruletas". Y es que probablemente la naturaleza de estos "deliciosos bugsnax" sea bastante más perturbadora de lo que sus colorines y diseños sugieren, encontrándonos ante una historia al puro estilo"body horror" en toda regla... en un título donde ni lo ves venir.
Bugsnax 
Une capture d'écran de Bugsnax
Par : 3dw4rd™

Recomendado EXCLUSIVAMENTE por su original propuesta, la cual compensa ampliamente su simplemente correcto y sencillito gameplay.

Ñam.

salty_tol_bean
0
25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2022
놀러와요 간식벌레의 섬으로

간식의 외형에 간식 이름의 울음소리를 내는 기묘한 벌레 버그스낵스로 가득한 스낵투스 섬에서 다양한 벌레들을 채집하고 실종된 그럼푸스 주민들을 찾아야 하는 액션 어드벤처 게임이다. 옥토대드(Octodad)를 개발한 Young Horses의 차기작인데, 옥토대드가 스토리고 게임성이고 한없이 가볍고 방정맞았던 것에 비하면 버그스낵스는 스토리와 게임성 모두 조금은 진중해진 모습이다. 버그스낵스와 그럼푸스의 생김새, 산뜻한 섬의 풍경, 그리고 밝고 가벼운 사운드트랙 등 비주얼과 사운드는 한결같이 가볍고 명랑하며 발랄한 분위기를 드러낸다. 한편 한국어 번역은 원본 특유의 아기자기한 폰트와 이미지를 살리지 못한 데다가 군데군데 어색한 번역이 보여 퀄리티가 조금 아쉽긴 하지만, 나름 참고 즐길 만하다.

버그스낵스에서 가장 눈에 띄는 부분이라면 역시 반은 간식이고 반은 벌레인 버그스낵스의 생김새라 할 수 있다. 가장 먼저 접하게 되는 딸기진디부터가 빨간 딸기에 다리가 달려있어 한눈에 봐도 딸기 모양을 한 벌레라는 걸 바로 알아차릴 수 있고, 게임 상에 존재하는 100여 종의 벌레들의 생김새가 전부 이런 식이다. 지극히 단순하면서도 직관적인 벌레들의 울음소리 역시 그냥 넘어갈 수 없다. 햄버거 모양을 한 딱정버거의 울음소리는 '버거버거버거버거버거'라 딱 들어도 햄버거 벌레구나 싶고, 마찬가지로 모든 벌레들의 울음소리 또한 전부 이런 식이다. 정말이지 세살바기 어린아이의 낙서를 그대로 옮겨온 듯한 익살스러운 광경이라 처음 마주하게 되면 자연스레 웃음이 터져 나오게 된다.

단순히 생김새와 울음소리만 다른 것이 아니라 특성도 제각각 다르다. 개체마다 크기와 속도가 다르고, 겁이 많아 피해 다니거나 저돌적으로 부딪혀오기도 하며, 몸뚱이에 불꽃이나 얼음이 달려있기도 하다. 나아가 6종의 소스나 다른 몬스터와의 관계에도 민감하게 반응하며, 섬의 각 구역마다 유사한 특성의 버그스낵스들이 생태계를 이루기까지 한다. 이렇다 보니 자연스레 각 버그스낵스를 잡기 위해 활용해야 하는 도구와 지형지물도 전부 달라질 수밖에 없다. 심지어 거대한 덩치를 지닌 전설급 버그스낵스는 아예 몬스터 헌터 급의 레이드를 치르기까지 해야 한다. 이렇듯 버그스낵스를 사냥하기 위해 스캔을 통해 특성을 파악하고, 스스로 해법을 궁리하며 보유한 도구와 주변 지형지물, 그리고 다른 몬스터를 활용해 버그스낵스를 채집하는 재미가 굉장히 일품이다.

버그스낵스의 사냥과 함께 곳곳에 흩어진 그럼푸스를 마을에 데려와야 한다. 털이 수북한 둥그런 몸에 팔다리가 달린 그럼푸스의 생김새가 왠지 모르게 친숙하게 다가오는 반면, 은근히 입이 좀 거친 데다가 성격 또한 되바라지고 잔망스러워 묘하게 매력적이다. 마을에 데려온 그럼푸스에게 채집한 버그스낵스를 먹일 수 있는데, 먹인 버그스낵스의 종류에 따라 그럼푸스의 생김새가 기묘하게 변한다. 팔다리부터 얼굴에 이르기까지 모든 부위에 변화를 가할 수 있고, 나중에는 먹인 버그스낵스에 따라 그럼푸스의 생김새를 자유자재로 바꿀 수 있어 이것이 소소하지만 깨알 같은 재미 요소가 된다. 다만 한 번 외형을 바꾼 그럼푸스는 다시 본래 모습으로 되돌릴 수는 없는 것 같은데, 이건 아무래도 스토리 상의 이유 때문인 듯하다.

한편 버그스낵스의 스토리는 실종된 리즈버트와 에거본에 대한 단서를 찾고, 여러 그럼푸스 사이의 화합을 다지는 과정을 담고 있다. 마을 안 그럼푸스들은 각자 개성이 뚜렷한 만큼 서로간의 관계도 명확하게 갈린다. LGBT 요소가 두드러지게 드러나는 게임이기도 한데, 그럼푸스라는 종족이 성별이 갈리는 것도 아니다보니 대체로 LGBT 요소가 자연스럽게 녹아든다. 덕분에 스토리 상에서 그럼푸스 간의 갈등 관계가 뚜렷이 드러나는데, 이것이 마치 가벼운 드라마 한 편을 보는 듯하다. 후반으로 접어들면 에거본과 리즈베트의 행방이 밝혀지면서 게임의 분위기가 급격히 무거워지는데 다행히도 이야기 전반에 이에 대한 떡밥과 암시를 잘 심어둬서 전개 자체의 무리수는 덜한 편이다. 조금은 허술하고 덜렁거리는 감이 있긴 해도 스토리의 완성도는 크게 뒤떨어지지 않는다.

순수한 창의력과 상상력을 그대로 게임에 녹여낸 이상적인 게임이다. 간식과 벌레를 꼭 반씩 섞은 버그스낵스의 생김새는 살짝 유치한 면이 있으면서도 아주 직관적이며, 도구와 지형지물을 총동원해 버그스낵스를 채집하고 그럼푸스에게 먹이는 과정이 아주 흥미로워 원초적인 재미를 상당히 잘 갖춘 게임이다. 잔혹하다고 할 만한 장면도 전혀 없어 동심을 자극하기 정말 좋아 남녀노소 누구나 재밌게 즐길 수 있다. 벌레에 대한 알레르기나 LGBT 요소에 대한 거부감만 없다면 누구에게나 강력히 추천할 수 있을 수작 인디 게임이다.

https://blog.naver.com/kitpage/222721222577

Tiki
0
21 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2022
Эта игра ассоциируется у меня с во-он той фермой слизи Slime Rancher, которая мне не понравилась и почему-то с китайским Харвестмуном My Time At Portia, хоть в последней и всё другое (ну, хотя... Геймплей без смертей, 3Д с няшной рисовкой, куча милых персонажей и простых квестов, оформление своего дома... не так уж мало у них общего). В общем, ловишь жукофруктов для квестов. По результатам квестов иногда получаешь новые инструменты, но в основном - ни на что не нужные украшалки для дома. И новые квесты, чтобы ловить жукофрукты. Как-то так. Сложно описывать игру, где смысл - в геймплее, а не в результате.

И честно говоря, игра по большей части детская. Умереть нельзя, сложных квестов и загадок нет, большую часть времени вы просто придумываете метод, а затем ловите всевозможные жукофрукты. Ну, правда, есть четыре "босса", но методику борьбы с ними вам разве что в красках не рисуют, И единственный беспокоящий аспект - это то, что с каждым съеденным жукофруктом окружающие люди (Бобры? Выдры? Суслики?) всё больше превращаются в эти самые фрукты, но ничего серьёзного с ними не происходит. До самого конца. Ну, почти до самого конца.

Потому что хоть результат для геймплея совершенно не важен (и даже в чём-то ему противоречит), сюжет здесь очень даже есть. И выглядит довольно мрачно, в разительном контрасте с картинкой и происходящим на экране. Вообще, это несколько неожиданно, когда ты обнаруживаешь, что под непритязательной казуалкой скрывается самый настоящий ужастик. Нет, строго говоря, он ненастоящий конечно, и ничего страшнее вышеописанного превращения так в игре и не произойдёт. Намёки все очень мягкие, кости и монстры настоящими не выглядят (а выглядят милыми и игрушечными), проблем никаких не видно, а всё, что выдумывают местные герои, оказывается далеко от реальности. Я уж было начал мысленно сочинять разгромный абзац "могло бы получиться хорошо, но авторы побоялись отпугнуть детей". Но нет! Заканчивается игра именно так, как и должна была закончиться, всё рассказав взрослому (и по-прежнему не особо отпугнув ребёнка), что резко добавило мысленной оценке пару баллов.

В общем, если ваших детей не испугают превращения милых антропоморфных бобров в не менее милые антропоморфные фрукты, и вы не боитесь показывать им гей-романы (он тут, впрочем, всего один) - игра подойдёт любому возрасту. Но особой глубины и хардкора не ждите - это всё-таки милая казуалка "собери их всех".
 
Smiling Spectre
4,415 produits enregistrés
0
24 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
26.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 mai 2023
80% adorable and charming, 20% creepy and mysterious. A friend recommended this game to me but the tag "psychological horror" amongst the contrasting cuteness of the game is what finally drew me in. The characters were quirky, well rounded, and diverse. The puzzles were fun and at times tricky but in the end easy to grasp and execute. I highly recommend if you like a game with low stakes, funky characters, and a mysterious story. Also.....Bunger!?

⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣧⠀⠀⠀⠙⣿⣿⡟⢻⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿
⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⠇⠀⠁⠀⠀⠹⣿⠃⠀⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿
⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡿⠛⣿⣿⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢐⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿
⣿⣿⣿⣿⠿⠛⠉⠉⠁⠀⢻⣿⡇⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢀⠈⣿⣿⡿⠉⠛⠛⠛⠉⠉
⣿⡿⠋⠁⠀⠀⢀⣀⣠⡴⣸⣿⣇⡄⠀⠀⠀⠀⢀⡿⠄⠙⠛⠀⣀⣠⣤⣤⠄⠀
 
GTric
0
29 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
8.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mars 2023
All too often, we fall into the traps that AAA gaming studios have been building up around us for years. People who enjoy gaming are often shifted towards games that have the best graphics, the longest playtime, the biggest names in voice acting, etc. The truth is that just as with everything else in life, quality trumps quantity every day that ends in "Y". Bugsnax is a delectable treat in gaming; an enjoyable experience that can be completed from start to finish in under 10 hours. The game's theme is top notch: the dedication to creativity, both in how the player utilizes the tools and environment presented to them and in the developer's design decisions regarding the bugsnax themselves. Not a single bugsnax discovery went past me without eliciting a chuckle or at least a grin: they are so damn cute and funny! I found myself exploring areas of Snacktooth island just mimicking the various bugsnax I came across. The way that the bugsnax say their name is so endearing and certainly a treat to behold. I am particularly fond of "Bunger". For a game that appears childish from the onset, Bugsnax is deceptively adult to its core. The muppet-like Wumpuses are actually people, people with very-human relationships and very-human problems. I did not expect to see a Wumpus with such bad depression that they could not get out of bed, yet that was not a topic that Bugsnax was afraid to stray away from. The story of the game was fun and interesting to follow across the length of the game. I appreciated all of the lore that was shared by the world around the player. The design of the island and the bugsnax was cohesive and creative in a way that is difficult to describe. The game is good looking, but not so graphically intensive that it is difficult to run. The music and sound design of the game is FLAWLESS, something I particularly enjoyed during my play through. The story's finale was interesting to say the least, and certainly set the Bugsnax universe up for a sequel ala Jurassic Park 2. A greatly enjoyed my time with the game and I encourage fellow cozy gamers to pick up the title whenever they get the chance!

Momimo11 👑
614 produits enregistrés
0
34 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
11.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 mai 2022
-Мы собираемся обсуждать недостатки моего брата?
С радостью начну.
Жалоба первая из двухсот девяносто четырёх...

Время прохождения ВСЕХ побочных заданий, сюжета + DLC = 10 часов.


✅ - СЮЖЕТ.
Не смотря на детский визуальный стиль, сам сценарий, окружение и диалоги некоторых персонажей довольно дерзкие.

По ночам на острове что-то происходит, и что-то плохое, непонятное.
Чем дальше продвигаешься по основному сюжету, тем более мрачным он становится.

Остров полон тайн, и их придётся разгадывать.


✅ - ИНТЕРЕСНОСТЬ.
В игре предстоит:
-> шпионить по ночам за жителями деревни.
-> брать интервью.
-> обустраивать свой дом.
-> проводить вечеринки
-> охотиться на огромную летающую пиццу
-> ставить опыты с отрезанием головы
-> играть в баскетбол
-> и прочее прочее прочее...


✅ - ПЕРСОНАЖИ.
У каждого свой характер, свой манера речи, своё мировоззрение.

Это отражается как поступками, так и окружением.
Тобишь у каждого хрумба дом обставлен по-своему, конкретно под его увлечения.

Взгляды на мир у персонажей меняются по ходу разных событий в игре, это круто.


✅ - ОЗВУЧКА.
Уделывает 90% ААА игр.

Актёры потрясающе передали эмоции происходящего и характер каждого персонажа, будь то суровый энгри-бёрдс или лайтовая любительница "дорогой дневник".


✅ - ЖУКОНЯМКИ.
Ползающий сэндвич, летающие роллы, бургер на куриных ножках KFC - это норма.
Именно на них придётся охотиться всю игру.
У каждой свой лор, свои страхи и свои слабости.
Тут есть "Инстаножка", которую можно поймать начав её фотографировать KEKW

Около 100 штук в игре разных (но не кардинально) нямок.


✅ - КОНЦОВКА.
Выше всяких похвал.
Неожиданная. Эпичная.


✅ - DLC.
Такими ДОЛЖНЫ ВЫГЛЯДЕТЬ АДЕКВАТНЫЕ ДОПОЛНЕНИЯ.

Бесплатное. Контента на полтора часа. Новая локация. Новые истории. Новые жуко-нямки.

Оно сделано довольно интересно, но чтобы его открыть нужно завершить побочные квесты 3-х персонажей.
DLC это остров, на котором по неизвестной причине обитают гигантские жуко-нямки, и предстоит выяснить - почему.


✅ - САУНДТРЕКИ.
Современные.
Скорее всего некоторые из них кто-то добавит в свой плейлист электронной музыки.



⚡ -СХОЖЕСТЬ СО SLIME RANCHER???
Нет. НЕТ. СХОЖЕСТИ НИКАКОЙ НЕТ.

В Слайм Ранчере нет персонажей, нет диалогов, это просто ферма.
БагСнэкс это полноценное сюжетное приключение.


⚡ -КАЗУАЛЬНОСТЬ.
Игра слишком простая, слишком расслабляющая.

Головоломки элементарные, босс-файты не составляют никаких проблем.
В игре попросту нельзя умереть.



❌ -КВЕСТЫ.
ВСЕ КВЕСТЫ, как сюжетные, так и побочные, на 90% состоят из - "сходи поймай тех жуконямок и скорми их мне".

Если у вас в запасе будут уже нужные жуконямки, то стоя на 1 месте и беседуя с одним персонажем вы можете пройти половину его истории (побочка), и 3 сюжетных квеста.


❌ -БАГ.
Если две жуко-нямки прыгнут в один куст, они обе пропадут и придётся идти спать, чтобы они зареспавнились.

Это раздражает.


❌ -ВЫБОР БЕЗ ВЫБОРА.
На протяжении ВСЕЙ игры разработчики дают тройной выбор в диалогах, при том что этот выбор одинаковый.
"Я возьму интервью у тебя."
"Зачем мне Лизберт, если есть ты."

The only other game I've replayed this many times and enjoyed it every time as if it was the first time all over again was Spyro. I can not recommend this game enough.

I had such a great time playing this game, and the DLC addition was so fun - albeit I'm also a bit of a sucker for cosmetic rewarded side quests sometimes.

Please play this game, its such a fun low-punishment game that encourages you to get creative with the tools you're provided while also allowing you to truly explore and do tasks without much consequence.

Badass Hobo
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
32.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2022
Not my typical style of game, I played this on a recommend from my brother. I still absolutely highly recommend, even if it doesn't look like your normal style, due to its fresh feeling gameplay and well-polished (horror-ish almost) story.

Game may look like a pokemon copycat, but it feels closer in style to games like A Hat in Time (minus the core focus on platforming). Your focus is not necessarily to "catch them all" but to use the bugsnax to progress and uncover the story.

I do recommend you do the side mailbox quests, they have some fun interactions with bugsnax that you don't see otherwise in the main game (they focus on proc'ing specific interactions between bugsnax, solving clues, or a few speedrunning type quests).

The game is definitely best played without looking at the trailer or too many screenshots. Part of the fun is the abject horror you feel as the characters consent to turning themselves into food, despite obvious warning signs that this is a bad idea.

The character's backstories are some of my favorite parts, which you can only uncover through their side quests Chandlo x Snorpy are my absolute favorite, what a cute couple. <3 Gramble is a close second.

Sam Reigel is the voice of Gramble and he does a superb job, but once you realize that, its hard to unhear FCG from Critical Role campaign 3, since his voice for Gramble is so similar to FCG. Personally, I find this entertaining. xD .

TL;DR Great unique game with fresh gameplay and intriguing story. Psychological horror user-defined steam tag is deserved.
 
xairin

Bugsnax is a seriously cute, fun and relaxing adventure. It scratched the same itch for me that Pokemon Snap did back in the day, while being way more expansive and fun.

Doublebagel47
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
4
Recommandé
30.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2022
Never have I ever been so compelled to give a thorough review for such a game. The last review I made was nothing more than a half-assed attempt to be "funny" 3 years ago. On the surface level, Bugsnax is not an entirely complex game - the description follows suit.

Just as the description seems simple, so is the game at it's core. What ended up being an impulse buy to play a casual game, ended up becoming a (perhaps) unhealthy obsession over the world, the characters, the environment, the setting. Everything was wonderful, and wonderfully goofy. The Bunger and it's glory is but one of the many Bugsnax that can be seen in game. It's a game that runs with it's concept, utilizing simple concepts to solve different puzzles, and though I can't tell you that this game offers an extremely varied way to solve everything, I can tell you that it gets close enough.

The development of characters - both physically and mentally - create a solid foundation of characters that you can love, and grow to love (or ultimately just hate). Those same characters are not as they first appear, nor are they static. They change as you help them change, offering to solve their problems - and by extension, help them grow through it. My addiction to side quests, whether attributed to my ADHD or not, was enhanced by the characters offering them, those likable and real people that are vibrant and exuberant, just like the scenery itself.

Speaking of which, this world isn't that huge once you've explored everything. Quite honestly, this isn't a particularly big game, taking around 10 hours to really push through the story. I find that it's the side characters and the missions you can do for them that makes this game much more huger. Though I have 100% on the achievements in Bugsnax, it doesn't mean that I've unlocked everything in the game. There isn't much merit for it other than personal, and I already feel achieved enough throughout this game.

A wonderful story, setting, character cast, and charming premise for a game that I assumed would be something I'd put down after an hour or 2. I can't believe that I spent so long on this game, but I know it was worth the time spent. Hell, a majority of the time was me streaming this game to my girlfriend, even the side-quests and letters that are arguably much better spent playing than watching. She played Bunger voice clips while a very dramatic scene was playing towards the end, so that was pretty lit.

Buy the game if you at least want something entertaining for a couple hours. It'll be worth the money, I guarantee it.
 
Crash

Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2022
I really didn't expect the characters to deal with things like loss, body image, self-doubt, and relationship difficulties (among many other things,) and was pleasantly surprised to be pulled into something so much more than looking at snack bugs.

I love the collection aspect and finding creative ways to catch bugsnax is really rewarding - not to mention the great art and mechanics.

Can't wait to finish this game and start all over! :))

Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2023
This game seems like it should be laughable at best if not downright terrible, but it's not. It's cute, charming, heartfelt at times, and incredibly satisfying to play. The cast of character's is diverse and interact well with each other, and collecting all of the titular Bugsnax rarely feels like a chore. Give this one a chance.
 
DoughnutBandit
115 produits enregistrés
0
23 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
33.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juin 2022
I've waited for exclusivity deals to expire and dodged spoilers for two years to play this game.

Was it worth it?
Yes. Yes it was.

Young Horses delivers again with a wildly creative and engaging monster collecting game featuring an expertly written cast of characters I grew fond for over the course of my playthrough. While I was drawn in by the cute bugsnax designs and the planning process behind catching them, learning about the residents of Snaktooth Island and breaking down their personalities, strengths, weaknesses, and so on while unraveling the mystery behind Lizbert's disappearance kept me hooked right up to the end.

Besides the story, Bugsnax is a game that encourages creative use of your tools and the environment when going about catching snax, and I was often finding very creative methods for using what i had on hand. While the game isn't incredibly punishing (you cannot get hurt or die in any way) it can still provide a unique challenge to new and seasoned players alike.

Overall, I found Bugsnax a wonderfully charming and engaging experience and would encourage giving it a try if it seems even remotely interesting to you.
 
Pepper
2
28 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3
Recommandé
23.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juillet 2022
What an amazing game. I'm usually pretty picky when it comes to games that focus so much on story telling and heavy dialogue, but more often than not I had a smile on my face even during admittedly cringey dialogue. I think this is in large part due to how well everything is broken up by the unique gameplay. It may appear like a pokemon clone at first, but it's far more than that. Even the large pool of fetch quests were fair more bearable than most games thanks to the variant each biome and Bugsnax adds to the world. I think a large portion of the fun I had was thanks to the friends I streamed for while playing this, but that in no way discredits how great this game is. My only complaint is the DLC content. Even though you can only reach it by the end of the game, it becomes strangely hand-holdy with new mechanics more obvious than previous ones. The DLC boss was also my least favorite out of the entire game, being way too clunky with the massive models inside of a space that felt too small for what was going on. On top of this, bugs were fair more apparent in this area of the game. Besides that, I highly recommend Bugsnax to anyone and hope that there's more DLC content or a sequel in the near future.
 
MockStar64
258 produits enregistrés
0
23 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
9.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
Bugsnax is a creative and colorful game that combines elements of adventure, puzzle-solving, and creature collecting. Players explore the mysterious island of Snaktooth, searching for and capturing different species of Bugsnax, and using their unique abilities to solve puzzles and progress through the story.

One of the standout features of Bugsnax is its diverse cast of characters, each with their own distinct personalities and quirks. You'll meet quirky and lovable inhabitants like Filbo Fiddlepie, the self-proclaimed mayor of Snaktooth Island, and Gramble Gigglefunny, the resident scientist who's obsessed with Bugsnax. As you interact with these characters and uncover the secrets of the island, you'll be drawn into the game's rich and immersive world.

The music in Bugsnax is also a highlight, with a catchy and memorable soundtrack that perfectly complements the game's lighthearted and whimsical tone. The game's colorful and vibrant art style also helps to bring the world and characters to life, making it a joy to explore and discover all that Snaktooth Island has to offer.

In terms of gameplay, Bugsnax is similar to games like Slime Rancher, where players are tasked with capturing and caring for a variety of creatures. However, Bugsnax differentiates itself with its unique setting, diverse cast of characters, and more puzzle-oriented gameplay. Players will need to carefully consider the abilities of each Bugsnax they capture and use them to solve environmental challenges and progress through the story.

Overall, Bugsnax is an enjoyable and unique game that's sure to appeal to fans of creature collecting and adventure games. Its memorable characters, challenging yet satisfying gameplay, and delightful art and music make it a standout title that's well worth checking out.
 
Bobby
1,064 produits enregistrés
0
19 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
3
Recommandé
7.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2023
"Bugsnax," a seemingly innocent foray into whimsy, unfolds into a harrowing nightmare, a psychological abyss that transcends conventional horror. Snaktooth Island, bathed in an eerie glow, devolves into a sinister labyrinth where reality warps with each flutter of a Bugsnak's wings. The once-charming creatures, now grotesque amalgamations of flesh and limbs, stalk your every move. Shadows whisper unsettling secrets, and the island's serene facade masks a malevolent force that preys on your deepest fears.

The protagonist's descent into madness is palpable, their sanity unraveling with each elusive Bugsnak. The ethereal soundtrack, once a playful melody, distorts into dissonant chords that echo through the haunted landscape. Inexplicable occurrences and spectral visions blur the line between reality and nightmare, forcing players to question their own sanity.

As you delve into the darkness, Bugsnax cease to be mere creatures; they morph into manifestations of your deepest anxieties. The once comforting crunch of a snack now induces terror, and the island's lush flora transforms into a twisted, sentient maze that distorts perception. The narrative, a web of psychological horror, leaves players grappling with existential dread, questioning the very fabric of their reality.

In this macabre odyssey, Bugsnax transcends its façade, leaving players with an enduring sense of dread. The horror is not confined to jump scares; it seeps into the subconscious, lingering like a malevolent specter. Bugsnax is not a game; it's a phantasmagoric descent into the abyss of the mind, an experience that will haunt your dreams and redefine your perception of horror in the gaming realm.
 
Miss Butch
665 produits enregistrés
0
17 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 aout 2022
What a brilliant game. I'm still unsure over what surprised me more about this game - the fact that the gameplay continuously remained fresh and fantastic or the elusively compact story and character writing. And yes seriously, even though the characters in this game look like Sesame Street stand-ins, each and every one of them present such compelling arcs that urge you to interact with them as much as possible. The entire game is a surprise in the best possible sense.

Catching each and every uniquely designed Bugsnax is a treat within itself - that core gameplay loop never becomes stale thanks to the large variety of methods and strategies the game allows you to experiment with when it comes to snagging one. Mixing and matching the tools in your arsenal to fashion more effective methods of capture never gets old - and the game pushes you to even utilise Bugsnax themselves in your experimentation, which leads to even more fun and super satisfying outcomes when it all comes together. Can't stress enough how much I enjoyed the gameplay, real surprise it never got stale at any point. As with the gameplay loop, the game also provides you a surprising amount of customization when it comes to your home or even the characters around you, freely being able to transform each of them into any of the 112 Bugsnax present in the game. In short, every playable facet of the game gives the player tons of room to experiment - so it never gets old.

The story, as many of those interested in this game may have heard, does indeed have a darker side to it. One of my fears going into this is that it would just be a random dark twist towards the end of the game - and while events towards the end are certainly more darker in tone compared to everything prior, there is a subtle dark tone of mystery that pervades the entire game, portrayed through ancient murals or elusive figures hiding in the dark... there are certainly secrets to be found that give the game a really compelling depth. The story never slowed for me personally, as its driven largely by a central mystery - one that really tickles your curiosity and keeps you going to discover more. The darker tones in particular are an awesome contrast against the generally light-natured surface of the game.

I would write further about the characters, but this review is already so long and I'm tired - but I urge you to play it for yourself to find out. At the beginning, many of them aren't particularly likeable - at least I felt so - but the fact that I came to genuinely care for each and every one of them, even the ones that irritated me the most at first, is a testament to the progression they all go through, depending on whether you choose to interact with them or not. And the game actively pushes you to do so - the main story is essentially about uniting a town broken by strife and fighting, so even if some characters irk you at first, caring for one of them will eventually encourage you to try reaching out to the others more. Its great. My personal favourites are probably Snorpy, Floofty, Wambus and surprisingly Beffica. Chandlo deserves a shout-out too.

My only complaint - and this isn't neccessarily a fault of the game - is that I personally placed too much stock in the "Psychological Horror" tag. Having been meaning to buy this game long before I finally did, my expectations of Bugsnax was morphed by continuously seeing people call it a horror and parade its darker tones - which made me expect far too much of that. So yes, personally I would say that the psychological horror tag on the game isn't warranted, but maybe that's cause my expectations for it in that regard were far too high. On the other hand, if you went into this game really just expecting a fun child-like game, then I can definitely see why you'd come away and slap a horror tag on it!

TLDR: Play this game, you won't regret it. Pure fun.

Edit: Even though this came out in 2020, I'm voting it as Steam GOTY. Because it is.
 
Amaiko

Recommandé
19.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 février 2023
I was told this was horror game, and maybe it is to some regard with the silly body horror and all, but I actually really thought this was a cute and wholesome game. Some of it was a little sad, but it kind of helped me mentally in other regards. You get to explore every character and watch them deteriorate or think lowly of themselves and try to overcome their mental obstacles. Myself going through troubles at the moment, I love when games add psychological issues or topics into them. Sometimes, it can even help the player with their own issues I feel. So, thank you for that.
Overall, this game is pretty insane. It's very silly and relaxing if you're looking to chill, get carried away for hours, or look at cute or colourful things. A lot of it is cute and the story, although a little messed up, is pretty wholesome. Even the ending is bittersweet and wholesome in a way.
If you're not interested in cute stuff, it's still a pretty messed up story. I won't spoil much, but it's really good!
Anyways, I usually don't post serious reviews and usually post silly ones, but I felt as though this game earned something from the heart here. It's easily become one of my most favourite games now!

Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2022
So, the game has been out for two days and I've already 100%ed it, with the secret ending easteregg too. Caught all of the bugsnax, including the new ones added with the DLC. You might say that doing all of this in two days, fitting in time to clean, cook, shower and sleep is symptomatic of a problem. However, I say it's symptomatic of a really good game. Honestly worth playing, especially if you love videogames with cool creature design. This game is quite dark and relatively intense, and the whole time wears the mask of a cheery game that'd probably be good for kids. Who knows, let them play it - it'll probably go over their heads and you can laugh together about Bunger.

Great game, worth playing.

0
25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
16.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2022
Come for the cheerful visuals, fun creatures, and catch-em-all gameplay; stay for the shockingly deep and emotional stories of these strange muppet creatures as you gradually learn of the sadness that pervades their lives. Seriously, the characters in this game feel surprisingly human with their respective situations and complex relationships. I'm not usually one for narrative-driven games, but this game kept me invested all the way through and beyond.

The free Isle of Bigsnax add-on adds an extra chapter that isn't super long, but lends even more insight into the characters and their lives before the game's events, which is always welcome. This was my third playthrough of the game after 100%-ing it twice on PS4, and I was never bored thanks to the new stuff. It even adds some new secrets to discover on the main island itself...

I like the LGBT rep in this game. There's a lesbian couple, a gay couple, and a non-binary character, and it's all just part of the world without waving virtue flags or drawing attention to any of it. Which is how it should be if we want to normalize it in real life, IMO.

One of the most pleasantly surprising games I've ever played. A must-have if you like deeply engaging characters and having the ability to transform them into food-based abominations.
 
Will T.TVR

Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2022
Just finished my playthrough and MAN I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME ENOUGH

The characters are all super charming and the Bugsnax themselves are all very well designed and adorable (even if some are a pain to catch (looking at you, Flamin' Cheepoof))

I won't give anything away, but the story and sidequests are engaging as all get out, and they all flowed perfectly into each other. And the free DLC, Isle of Bigsnax, is also wonderful, fleshing out some of the characters that didn't quite get as much attention as the rest of the cast.

Honestly a 10/10 experience and if any of you are having a bad day go look at the Bunger Plush they have on their fangamer page it INSTANTLY made my night.

BugsNSNxaxx....

ՏρȝՇԵ3ՐՐ
262 produits enregistrés
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
32.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2023
Bugsnax is an adventure game where you play as a journalist who is tasked to go to Snaktooth Island in search of Elizabert Megafig, a famous explorer who feels like you're the best person to spread the news of Bugsnax and how amazing they are. However, when arriving on the island, you discover that Elizabert has disappeared, and you're tasked with finding her while also doing a variety of other tasks across Snaktooth Island.

The story is pretty straightforward. It is mostly what I've described already, but you also need to solve the problems of all the residents of Snaktooth Island and reform their community while also discovering the secrets of the island. It is a pretty basic story, but that doesn't matter, as the act of discovering Bugsnax and catching them is such a joy. It also helps that the characters are all a bundle of different personalities with great voice acting, so this helps improve the story even more.

The main gameplay of this game is centered around discovering and catching Bugsnax. You're given a variety of tools and traps to help you with the task of catching these critters. You have snak traps, bug nets, sauce slingers, and more. They are all really fun to use and are pretty clever in their usage. It is a satisfying gameplay loop, and I found it very enjoyable. However, after you play for a while, the gameplay starts to become a bit annoying, as the later half of the game often has you catching Bugsnax you've already encountered in order to complete some quest for an NPC.

The graphics are also a wonderful aspect of this game. Everything is stylized to suit this game. The NPCs, the Bugsnax, the UI, the items, etc. Everything looks cartoony but in a really nice way.

The sound design is also quite good and comforting. The sounds that the Bugsnax make remind me of Pokemon but just a bit more tasty. The fact they are literal walking foods just makes their noises all the better. The music is also very calming and fitting to the environments you travel through. Also, as mentioned before, the voice acting is very good. All of the voices fit each of the character's personalities and actually make them feel distinct from one another.

Overall, this game is a nice little gem. Sure, it seems a bit like a meme, and it does get a bit boring after a while, but it is honestly a good game. It is simple, effective, and engaging for the majority of the playthrough. I most definitely recommend giving this one a shot! Also, I love Bungers. They are wonderful little creatures.
 
VinroyIsViral

Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

I am Elizabert Megafig, and I'm here to ask you a question... Is a Grump not entitled to the Snax off their brow?

"No!" says the man in Grumpington, "it belongs to the poor."
"No!" says the man in the Snaxtican, "it belongs to God."
"No!" says the man in Mosgromp, "it belongs to everyone."

I rejected those answers, instead I chose something different, I chose the impossible... I chose - Snaxburg!
 
PolitePunk
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2022
Didn't expect to enjoy it as much as I did, but honestly the gameplay is a great break from your usual story shooter. Characters are decent, story is decent (nothing groundbreaking and pretty short), the environments and creature design are amazingly endearing though. Has the same sorta draw as something like Stardew Valley does for me, just relaxing and fun.

Gameplay is very simple but very enjoyable tbh, gives you that satisfaction of completing your collection but doesn't make it impossible to 100%, just challenging enough to be fun without being super frustrating.

The "horror" element that I've seen a few people mention is a bit of a stretch. There is a twist, but it's pretty predictable and nothing super out there. So don't go into it expecting things to take a turn towards lovecraft or anything.

Regardless, very fun little game, gave me a good amount of enjoyment for 3 or 4 days. Definitely worth it on a good sale if you're looking for a nice singleplayer experience to spend a few days on.

Most important note, Bunger and Bunger variants are the GOAT (luv me BBQ Bunger).

18.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 décembre 2023
A unique combination of creature collection and puzzle game. I really enjoyed Bugsnax, it offers something a little bit different. You're a reporter searching for a missing explorer on an island filled with bugs. Use a variety of tools combined with the environment to lay traps and capture creatures to progress the game. Fulfil requests, collect decor, and solve the mysteries of the island! A very cute looking game that's lots of fun. Recommended.
 
PinkRayne
317 produits enregistrés
0
18 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
5
Recommandé
16.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2022
Bugsnax is a wonderful combination of cute artwork, fun quests, exploration, creative tools, and real sh*t. I'm telling you, dude, there are some pretty constructive social themes in the dialogue here, and it's awesome.

You learn a lot about every character, and their relationships with other Grumpuses. Some more than others, ofc - and they still have little cartoon personalities - but even with the veil of "cute colorful kids game," it's got great interpersonal development. It's structured like a cartoon, but there are plenty of mature conversations around how to navigate your relationships, communication, finding courage, seeing value in your capabilities, and accepting your limitations as a person - all in a digestible format, contextualized for the setting this game exists in. Like I said: This game contains real sh*t, if you ask me.

What surprised me the most was how absolutely marvelously this game normalizes identities of all kinds, from personality to gender to orientation. Every Grumpus' identity is totally diverse and presented as normal. It's refreshing to see a game in which characters are able to exist in many different forms without those forms being subject to criticism from within the writing, or even to harmful stereotypes. Granted, I couldn't give you an example of a game that does either of those things, but this was a pleasant surprise nevertheless. You don't see a nonchalantly non-binary character with everyone being totally chill with their pronouns like it's an average Tuesday every day, do you? Nope! Not even on Tuesdays!

The story of the island revealed itself very suddenly, but there were always hints at what was to come. I really enjoyed this story, and I especially liked the dark theme underneath the cute and colorful mask.

Overall, absolutely recommend. Great game, great characters, great writing. I hope other games can live up to this gem. Thanks for reading!
 
poopfish5000
0
16 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
16.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 19 mai 2022
I never imagined myself sitting down and attempting to write a legitimate review of Bugsnax of all games, but here we are. I think it's safe to say it started off regarded by many as sort of a meme game, something that would TRULY SHOW OFF THE ABILITIES OF THE XBOX 5000. I mean, it was made by the same folks who made OctoDad, a game that singlehandedly paid the rent of countless screaming YouTubers in the mid 2010s. All of the characters kinda look like Muppets. There's a dude called Filbo Fiddlepie and a Bugsnak called Scoopy Banoopy for cryin out loud.

There's also the theme song by KKB but I can't add much commentary to something that's already perfect.

All of this aside, Bugsnax has become one of my all-time favorite puzzle games. The story is goofy and the characters lovable, but the game manages to touch on serious emotional and interpersonal themes while keeping everything balanced. The gameplay is engaging, rewarding thinking outside of the box and experimenting with the world and the Bugsnax that live in it. It takes DNA from Viva Pinata, Pokemon/Pokemon Snap, and the 2011 Animal Planet reality TV series Finding Bigfoot, four of the greatest pieces of media known to mankind, and blends them together to create a real good time.
The developers, Young Horses, have already added all kinds of free content that flesh out the world and give you plenty to do both before and after completing the main story. It's also got my man YURI LOWENTHAL playing the BEST CHARACTER. God the characters/voice actors are so good.

If you decide to give Bugsnax a try, please try to go in blind. The less you know the better. Hahah Tame Impala googoo gaga.
 
Rocka
