Évaluation publiée le 2 mai 2022
半分食べ物、半分虫、おかしな生き物バグスナックスが暮らすスナックトゥースアイライドで冒険に出発だ！
見た目のかわいらしさとは裏腹に手ごたえあるバグスナックス捕獲。
かわいらしいキャラクター、バグスナックとそれを求める島民が織り成す重厚なストーリー。
『なぜ私達は食事をするのか？』この食が飽和した時代に直に問いかけてくる。
毎日何の気なしに消費されていくファストフード、人間の都合で作り変えられた食物達。
これを手にとってプレイしてみてほしい。
これまでの食に対する考え方を180度変えてくれる事請け合いだ。

私はこのゲームに出会うために生まれてきたのかもしれない。

7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
17.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 septembre 2022
환상의 섬 스낵투스 섬에서 버그스낵스의 비밀을 파헤쳐나가는 어드벤처 수집형 게임입니다.
본편 100마리의 버그스낵스가 있고, dlc로 추가 버그스낵스도 있어 수집요소도 꽤 있을 뿐만 아니라. 메인,사이드,메일 퀘스트 등 다양하게 준비되어있어서 즐길 거리가 다양합니다.

스토리도 나름 신선헀고, 나중에 버그스낵스의 진실에 다가갔을 때.. 이 또한 새롭게 다가왔네요. 사실 중간중간 복선을 심어두긴 했는데 그래도 그 떄의 내용이 꽤나 인상 깊었네요

버그 스낵스를 캡처하는 것도 다양한 기믹이 있습니다. 그 기믹에 따라 포획도 가능하고 스토리 진행 중에도 다양한 퍼즐요소가 가미되어 즐길거리가 다양한게 재밌게 플레이 했었습니다.

다만,, 버그스낵스를 먹을때 캐릭터들이 각 버그스낵스 특징으로 몸의 부위가 바뀌게 되는데 그 몇몇 것들이 좀 불쾌해보이는 무언가가 있었습니다. 그래서 태그에 심리적 공포가 붙은 거 같네요.

아쉬운건 메일퀘스트가 꽤나 지루했긴 하지만.. 생각보다 분량이 꽤 되고 스토리랑 플레이도 참신해서 재밌게 플레이 했습니다.
 
Kriptos
364 produits enregistrés
0
6 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
18.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 septembre 2023
This is genuinely one of my favorite games ever. I haven't played it in a bit but I keep thinking about it again and again wishing that I could forget everything about this game and start again from zero. I loved this game in its entirety. Everything about this game is fun. The world is interesting, the story is good, the gameplay is fun, the characters are endearing, the bugsnax are cool and never get boring when you keep finding new ones to catch, the twist is not TOO shocking, but still intriguing nonetheless, and on top of that, the steam achievements for the game aren't too difficult either. I found myself getting genuinely invested in the story and characters of the game as every one of them is interesting in their own ways and have their own little quirks that make them fun. For example, every character has their own distinct accent which I noticed while I was playing and found quite cool. Also, the mechanics never get boring since they add new ones after a while to keep things interesting. All in all, Bugsnax is an awesome game and I would genuinely recommend it to everyone. Just get it. You'll like it, I'm sure.
 
komio223
203 produits enregistrés
0
9 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
18.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 janvier 2023
Если бы была возможность, то я бы скорее поставил нейтральную оценку Bugsnax.

Из очевидных для меня плюсов: в игре приятная и забавная озвучка как колоритных персонажей, так местных "покемонов" и проработанные жизненные диалоги, наполненные забавными моментами. Очень порадовало, что у каждого монстра свои собственные звуки. Если поиграете - поймете о чем я. Выглядит упорото :D

Первые 5-6 часов геймплей довольно интересный: с помощью различных приспособлений нам нужно будет поймать Жуконямок. Для поимки того или иного "покемона" нужен определенный предмет - для одного из противников нужна просто клетка или мины, а для другого, например, нужно будет с помощью трамплина отправить его в воду или стравить с другим существом. В общем, механики довольно интересные и их даже можно между собой комбинировать, но ко второй половине игры весь процесс ловли превращается в рутину. К счастью, ближе к концу появляется несколько боссов, которые внесли в Bugsnax немного разнообразия. Если бы не они, то я скорее всего не завершил бы прохождение этой игры.
 
NyBras ✓

Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2022
기믹과 싸우는 즐거운 수집게임
정말 재밌게 플레이 했습니다. 배경음도 좋고, 몬스터가 내는 울음소리도 귀여워서 좋았습니다. 이외에 스토리나 게임성 또한 적당히 잘 잡아내서 몰입감있게 플레이 한 것 같습니다.

몬스터의 종류는 대략 100여종 정도입니다. 개중에는 전설의 몬스터라 하여 보스전을 포함한 보스 몬스터도 있습니다. 전체적인 게임플레이는 기믹으로서 몬스터를 제압하고 잡는 형식을 취하고 있습니다. 몬스터마다 잡아야하는 방식이 달라서 새로운 몬스터를 접할때마다 머리쓰는 맛이 있었기 때문에 즐거웠습니다.

게임의 볼륨도 상당한 편으로, 열심히 해도 대략 25시간정도 걸릴 것으로 생각합니다. 단순히 몬스터를 잡는 것에서 끝나는 것이 아니라, 잡은 몬스터를 통해 옷입히기 같은 느낌으로 주민을 꾸밀 수 있고, 편지 퀘스트를 통해 주인공 캐릭터의 집을 꾸밀 수 있는 가구들을 수집할 수 있는 점이 좋았습니다.

모든 메인, 서브, 편지 퀘스트를 깨고 도전과제까지 마무리했지만, 여전히 좀 더 즐길거리를 주면 좋겠다고 생각합니다. 2편 내지 DLC를 기대하고 있습니다. 강력 추천합니다.

Évaluation publiée le 3 juillet 2022
I honestly bought this game because it was tagged "Psychological Horror" and I thought it was be some trippy scary stuff with a cutesy design like Poppy Playtime or Five Nights, but it wasn't at all. What this game IS, however, is super fun! The story is great, the design is unique and wonderful to look at and explore, the game play and puzzles are just the right level of difficult without being exhausting/frustrating, the characters are excellent (props to the voice actors, they all nailed their parts!), the boss battles are all different and creative...just nothing but good things to say about this game. 5 stars, 10/10, HIGHLY recommend.

WUTAR356
1,005 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
22.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 aout 2023
Bugsnax: A Whimsically Absurd Adventure

Let's dive into Bugsnax. This oddball odyssey by Young Horses serves up charm and humor that keep its gameplay engaging over its 9 to 10-hour duration. Despite the baffling trailers, Bugsnax is a story-driven first-person adventure with light puzzles, surprising depth, and delightful character development. It might not flaunt PlayStation 5's power, but Snaktooth Island is a must-visit—just be cautious about overindulging in its wildlife cuisine.

In Bugsnax, you're a news reporter brought to Snaktooth Island by explorer Elizabert Megafig to cover its edible creatures. Yep, Bugsnax are animals that mutate consumers upon consumption. Totally normal, right? The island's inhabitants, grumpuses (fur-covered humans), add to the delightful chaos.

Bugsnax are a visual treat, with distinct appearances from flying pizzas to swimming soda cans. The Spuddy, a butter-topped potato charging at you, is a personal favorite.

The main task is rallying Snaxburg's residents back home for interviews. But each grumpus has requests, and Bugsnax, being the primary food source, are crucial. While the missions follow a similar pattern, top-notch writing and voice acting keep each grumpus unique and engaging.

Bugsnax is absurd but also meaningful, touching on subjects like relationships, mental health, and loss. The humor keeps things light, and the game is full of laughter, both from the creatures and the grumpuses.

Catching Bugsnax involves scanning them with your camera and using tools to nab them. The metroidvania-like elements add depth. However, the real magic is in Bugsnax's storytelling, keeping you hooked with its characters and narrative surprises.

Bugsnax is odd and delightful. Its gameplay might have moments of repetition, but its heart—its story and characters—makes the journey worth it. It's a story with over 100 Bugsnax to discover, somehow making you care for these quirky critters.

Anyways this game is a trip, have fun!
 
Kenstagator
2,214 produits enregistrés
0
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
29.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 septembre 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

Huge thanks to the Young Horses Games Discord for providing me with a Steam key. You all are such goated devs and I’m proud to support you since the launch of Octodad back in 2014!

Kinda bug and kinda snack feed somebody and you’ll see we are whatever we eat…

Bugsnax is an adventure game released back in 2020 on Playstation 4 & 5 and Epic Games Store. It takes place on a mysterious island called Snaktooth which is a home for these interesting creatures called “Bugsnax'' which as you have guessed are half bug and half snack.

Story
You play as a journalist who writes articles about mysterious incidents and unknown anomalies. In the beginning you receive a video message from Lizbert Megafig the fame explorer essentially inviting YOU, the journalist, to the said island so you could investigate the Bugsnax being the best person to tell the world about them by making a huge article about it saving your career along the way. With her associates, Lizbert built a settlement called Snaxburg in order to better study the Bugsnax. Half bugs, half snacks - no one has ever seen anything like it and what awaits the protagonist on this journey is up to YOU, the player, to discover.

Note from myself
I discovered this game on the Nintendo Switch over a year ago, and I was deeply invested in it until I caught every single snack on the island, completed every single quest, and unlocked every available achievement. This is truly one of my greatest achievements because not only did I really enjoy doing so, but it was also very rewarding. The game captivated me with its charm, uniquely designed characters and creatures, engaging gameplay that requires you to think outside the box from time to time, the catchy soundtrack, and the intriguing story that kept me engaged until the very end. I almost completed it in one go the first time. Later on, I purchased the game on the Epic Games Store so I could play it on my newly acquired Steam Deck, and I enjoyed it even more in high definition, with an increased field of view and smoother frame rates. This was indeed a dream game for me after a long while.
Recently, after the announcement that the VR version of Bugsnax was in development and the public beta was available for virtually anyone with a VR headset, I reached out to the Young Horses Games Discord to ask if the beta would ever be coming to the Epic Games Store. Eventually, I was DM'd by one of the devs with a Bugsnax Steam key, a gesture I will definitely remember for a long while.
P.S. The VR version is also great, although it's still far from being finished.

Gameplay
The gameplay can be described as a miniature BOTW or, for comparison, "Journey to the Savage Planet." You are set in an open world filled with different types of "Pokemon-like" creatures. You are equipped with an arsenal of different traps to catch them, and all of them unlock progressively during the story in a sort of Metroidvania way. Each Bugsnack requires a different approach to catch them, and that's what makes it so fun - figuring out exactly how to do it. Whether you experiment or use unconventional methods because you lack a certain trap at the moment, it all works, and that's what I like about this game - the open approach and sandbox nature of being able to catch Bugsnax in different ways.
During the story, you visit all sorts of biomes, each one very different from another, and they all feature their own Bugsnax adapted to live in these conditions. Some of them only appear during certain times of the day or under specific weather conditions, and this ecosystem truly makes the world feel alive. Some snacks appear more dangerous than others and require a special approach, but the game doesn't have a health bar or any sort of fail state, so you can try to catch them as many times as you need.
The game doesn't consist solely of gameplay. Sometimes, the action settles down into narrative cutscenes, showing relationships between the Grumpuses, their daily life on the island, or sometimes their deepest secrets. The writing is genuinely good, even if it's overwhelming at times, but I still like it. The game also features bosses, but this is more in spoiler territory; it's best that you see them for yourself. Overall, it's very satisfying, has great controls, engaging puzzles, and a variety of different environments and characters you can love, hate, or Snackify to the point they're unrecognizable.

Soundtrack
The soundtrack is written by Seth Parker. The same guy who also wrote the Octodad OST and I noticed that they were pretty similar. The songs vary in genre from track to track, sometimes they give out a chill vibe, sometimes they are electronic or dramatic. Doesn’t matter what situation you're in, the soundtrack always accompanies the whole experience too well. If nobody’s got me I know that the Bugsnax OST does.
10/10 - Hey, we're making this funny game about sentient food with googly eyes don’t go too hard on the OST. Seth Parker: hold my Sodie.

Conclusion
Overall, Bugsnax is a fantastic treat for all indie game enthusiasts and those who are open to experimenting with new titles. It has the potential to carve out a special place in your heart, but it can also be enjoyable in any case. It's worth noting, however, that this game may not appeal to everyone. For instance, individuals who are arachnophobic, sensitive to themes of body dysmorphia, or uncomfortable with queer representation in media might not find it to their liking.

But otherwise, The creators of Octodad did not reinvent the wheel and come up with another game with awkward controls and funny physics. This is a fun adventure for a couple of evenings that can be stretched out if you enjoy catching adorable creatures. The game is available on all modern platforms even on the iOS and SteamVR so you can enjoy the thrilling Snaxcatching action on anything, anywhere, anytime.

10/10 - Y’all just get along now i’ll ketchup.

 
Sol3K
652 produits enregistrés
0

Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2022
Bugsnax

You start off as a journalist in need of a story.
Upon taking the job, you head off to an island full of weird monsters called Bugsnax.
You'll meet all kinds of Bugsnax, but also ''people'' who live there.

And so your adventure begins!

I've enjoyed it more than i thought i would, spend a full day just playing this game.
Got fun characters, some more annoying than others.
Animations and graphics are to my liking.

Story is interesting!

Easy to 100%.

Overall, a fun experience.
 
Draxaze
1,009 produits enregistrés
0
15 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
23.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
I had this game on my wishlist for years, in my mind marked as merely 'maybe interesting'. On my wishlist it remained through numerous sales because I had other priorities. A friend gifted me Bugsnax for Christmas this year and I finally had to try it. I wasn't disappointed.

Bugsnax has a bit of everything.
- Your thirst to collect will be quenched.
- Challenges, both easy and medium ones (none are hard, I struggled a bit with one of the letter quests because I was unlucky, but that's it)
- Characters with exaggerated personalities
- Possibilities to be creative through customizing both the grumpuses and your house
- Achievements, all doable and not too trying
- Amazing design choices in a lot of places
- Fun tools and weapons to aid you

Bugsnax is in many ways a beautiful game. I wasn't too big a fan of the grumpuses design, and I actually found their faces a bit distracting when the story unfolded. I had a hard time taking the story seriously with the grumpuses looking like they do. On the other hand, the environment and the bugsnax themselves are beatifully designed. A LOT of fantasy went into making this game and it's hard not to appreciate that.

It does feel that the game tries very hard to be PC, which annoyed me a bit. It just didn't feel natural, but again, with all the fantasy maybe that wasn't even the point.

Overall I had a very good experience. It took me about 20 hours to finish, including doing all the side quests and letter quests. I also spent a good amount of time just screwing around looking for hats, customizing my house and shooting hoops. Bugsnax is casual if you want it to be, and not if you don't. You decide.

I warmly recommend this game.
 
Power King
0
12 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
19.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mars 2023
The game is a ton of fun and really unique, despite clearly being inspired by other games. I enjoyed playing it and I really liked the atmosphere. The monster design is really creative and catching bugsnax is mostly a lot of fun. The characters are lovable and cute and the quests are fun.

The major criticisms I have revolve exclusively yaround the end of the game.

First off: the gameplay at the very end is really shallow. In the main game, the bugsnax never really being a mortal threat never bothered me. The bugsnax never seemed like monsters that willing to kill anyone, so it made sense.
Now, obviously that was no longer the case, when the game suddenly decided to depict Bugsnax as a serious threat. Suddenly, you are left with no tension, when you know that nothing can happen to you or the NPCs.
Killing bugsnax also just feels ... wrong. More on that in a moment.

So that brings me to the ending from a narrative standpoint.
Here's the problem: I really don't think that writing bugsnax as the "villains" of the story was a good idea. Maybe the idea here was to convey some sort of anti-consumerist message, but it is a really unsatisfactory turn of events, nevertheless. Having a good message is good and all, but it shouldn't come of the cost of the quality of the story. Think about it: the player spends most of the game getting to know and dealing with these cute critters (at least as much time as with the Grumpuses!) - maybe even donating them to the farm and giving them cute hats- so you kinda have to anticipate that they'll develop a bond with them.
*They* are the stars of this game - hence the title ! , so finding out that they're actually evil parasites with an sinister agenda simply didn't feel right. Maybe I missed something, but that was my impression when the credits rolled.

And finally, it seems like the creators wrote themselves into a corner here, at least, if they plan on making a sequel (which I really hope they do - this title deserves one). I don't see a way of continuing the story in an interesting way, at least not without retconning parts of the story.
 
Gandaleon
475 produits enregistrés
1
7 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mai 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Great story, amazing voice actors, fantastic game

Bugsnax is a fun game where you collect bugs that look like snacks. You play as a journalist reporter who was invited to Snaktooth island by world renown explorer, Elizabert Megafig, to come interview and report on Snaktooth island. Making it to the island you find out that Snaxburg, the settlement Lizabert set up, is abandoned and Elizabert is nowhere to be found. The last remaining resident and only mayor, Filbo, asks for your help to bring everyone back to town and help find Elizabert, while collecting bugsnax for the hungry townsfolk.

The game at first glance is very silly and childlike. The game is very bright and vibrant, you have walking food creatures with googly eyes saying their names like Pokemon do and with names like Filbo Fiddlepie, Wambus Troubleham, and Gramble Gigglefunny, you'd probably assume this is a baby game made for small babies. Well you aren't entirely wrong... but you are still wrong. Bugsnax is a game that can be enjoyed by all ages where you collect and and document bugsnax. Yes there are silly names with silly food bugs running around, but the characters are incredibly well written with amazing voice actors that brush over mature themes that even us big kids are more than familiar with. I can't emphasize enough how fantastic the voice work is for this game. The contrast of what the characters are talking and the vibrant carefree world they live in makes it even funnier. The further along in the story you get the more serious the tone of the game is, with an intense and horrifying twist near the end.

If you have the money, buy this game. It's fun to play and is easy to pick back up again after a long break. The story good, the characters are endearing, it scratches the completionist itch, and it's just a fun game to sit down and unwind to.
 
Señor
741 produits enregistrés
0
5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 juillet 2022
Bugsnax - игрой про загадочный остров, на котором из еды только соусы да жуконямки. Что? Да!

В игре даже сюжет есть: искательница приключений находит этот остров и приглашает журналиста, чтобы явить это чудо свету. Журналист - это мы, если что. И, разумеется, наша летающая посудина терпит крушение, так что мы застреваем на острове только чтобы узнать, что искательница приключений пропала, а все, кого она собрала, без нее расползлись по острову и страдают, потому что самостоятельно ловить жуконямок почти никто не может.

В итоге мы ловим жуконямок (что и является основной частью игры), собираем народ в поселении, разгадываем местные тайны, а также тайны жителей и их трагические истории. Там и неудачливая поп-дива, и конспиролог, и сумасшедший ученый, и... в общем, очень пестрая компания. Ах да, я уже сказал, что мы заодно ищем пропавшую исследовательницу и ее жену? Теперь сказал.
Так что занятий, как всегда, по горло.


Жуконямок очень много, способов их поймать - тоже. Некоторых не берет ловушка, и нужно их оглушить. Другие горят, и надо найти способ их потушить прежде, чем ловить. Третьи летают. Четвертые агрессивные, пятые ползают под землей, шестые вообще боссы и доступны только под конец личной линейки квестов какого-либо персонажа. Но знаете, что самое прекрасное? Если персонаж съедает жуконямку, одна из его частей тела трансформируется в соответствие с видом съеденного. И в какой-то момент нам выдают прибор, позволяющий формировать облик откормленных персонажей на свое усмотрение!

Впрочем, на фоне всего этого веселья вечно сквозит какая-то жуткая тайна. И я вам про нее ничего не расскажу, это лучше воспринимается изнутри игры) Которая - за исключением тем отрубания собственной головы или поедания конечностей, коллективных могильников, поглощения живых существ в сыром виде и других милых изюминок - очень милая, яркая и ненапряжная. Отлично подходит, чтобы неспешно ползать и пытаться расслабиться, не слишком задумываясь о чем-то серьезном.
 
Leviathan

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
6.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2022
整蛊游戏 ，细节完善，玩法多样，无论是怪还是人物都有点萌中整蛊。总体个人感觉不亏，流程不长但又没好玩到沉迷，适合拿来放松休闲。
剧情我还没玩完，看村子大家从一开始的分离崩析到后来握手言和还是挺有成就感的。虫子的外形就是各种食物的组合，每个都有不同的特性，需要思考怎么组合手中道具才能达到精准捕捉。不仅是虫子有很多细节，包括人走在地上的爪印，下雨的效果，自己着火也会引燃虫子，各个方面看的出来都是打磨过的。之后打巨大虫子的演出效果也相当刺激有趣。
缺点大概就是各个任务没有特别明确的提示，导致有时候大脑卡壳一卡就卡很久，有些任务判定太严格，譬如浇水扫描，一定要扫浇水瞬间的那块土，这谁能想到。
男女皆宜，买了不亏

i really tried to love this game but i just found it really boring and a tiny bit generic
it was really exciting in the beginning but then i guess the "novelty" kinda worn off.
but if you enjoyed this game i could totally see why, but this game just wasn't for me.
i really admire the visuals and the voice actors though.
i agree with a lot of the negative reviews about the gameplay and story and i would DEFINITELY recommend to read them before you buy.
😊

edit: i've completed all the mail tasks and honestly they were pretty fun (it kinda sucks you can use the same method to catch most of the bugsnax though) i think what really made me slightly dislike this game was the characters and story. i didn't connect with or root for any of them. i really hated wiggle..

15.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 mai 2022
Es ist ein unerwartetes hin und her zwischen meinem inneren Kind, welches das Spielprinzip, das Fangen der Bugsnax's und das begeisterte erkunden von Orten toll und faszinierend findet und dem erwachsenem Ich, welches den überraschend guten Plot und den ganzen Beziehungen der Grumps untereinander erkannt und gefesselt hat.

Ich muss gestehen das ich anfangs vom Spiel keinerlei hohen Ansprüche hatte. Ein Spiel wo man kleine "Nahrungskäfer" mit Kulleraugen fängt und sie an Stadtbewohner verfüttert klang im ersten Augenblick mehr nach einem kleinen Zeitvertreib aber mit fortlaufendem Plot und verbundenen Einzelheiten (die ich ungern nennen will wegen Spoilergefahr) wurde es immer und immer interessanter! Und ja auch die Kulleraugen reißen es für mich vollkommen raus! Bitte, die sind zu herrlich.
Auch die einzelnen verschiedene emotionalen Gefühle und das Gendern gefällt mir sehr! Trotzgleich das es eine niedliche Optik hat (und wieder erwähnt Kulleraugen!) ist der Plot sehr sehr gut. Es geht auf einzelne Themengebiete ein, macht das ganze ein wenig nachfühlbar und man gewinnt doch den ein oder anderen Charakter darinnen lieb.

Das Einzige was ich mir wünschen würde, keine Kritik an dieser Stelle, wäre eine effektivere Möglichkeit gegen Bugsnax mit elemantaren Eigenschaften anzugehen. Es ist manchmal ein wenig verzickt, was für den Ein oder Anderen wohl gerade der Reiz dafür ist.

Auf jeden Fall werde ich dieses Spiel noch weiter spielen und wieder anfangen! Das ist zu gut.
 
Ship happens

Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2022
주변에 버그스낵스라는 스낵+곤충이 합쳐진 애들이 돌아다니는데 포켓몬스터처럼 잡고 다니는 게임입니다.

근데 이건 포켓몬이랑은 다른게, 잡아서 먹을수가 있습니다. 근데 먹으면 그 곤충형태로 몸 한쪽이 변합니다

그렇다보니 귀여운 예고편과는 달리 사람마다 혐오적으로 보일수도 있습니다 버그스낵스 얘내들도 생긴게 이상하고,

소리 낼때는 자기랑 합쳐진 스낵이름이랑 비슷한 소리를 냅니다.

예를 들면 딸기벌레가 초반에 나오는데 strabby strabby~ 소리냅니다. 햄버거랑 합쳐진 벌레는 bunger bunger 소리냅니다

절대 어린이용 게임은 아닌거같네요. 어린애들이 하면 동심파괴 될듯하네요.
 
Kwak.Dae.Geun
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
31.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 janvier 2023
Melhor que Pokemon u-u

Quando Bugsnax foi anunciado lá atrás (acho que no State of Play do ano passado) pouca gente levou a sério, talvez porque estavam ansiosos esperando anúncios pra nova geração ou porque o que foi apresentado parecia ser um jogo totalmente infantil pokemon like. Eu mesmo achei completamente desinteressante. Mas recentemente tudo mudou quando eu ocasionalmente assisti um trecho de gameplay pelo Alanzoka e fui tomado sem mais nem menos por uma vontade inexplicável de jogar esse jogo. E a decisão não poderia ter sido melhor.

O jogo tem uma estética bem simples e realmente parece voltado para crianças, mas no fundo seus sistemas ateh tem uma certa complexidade. A parte Pokemon de Bugsnax foi um acerto e tanto. A ilha onde você está preso eh povoada com mais de 100 espécies de inseto-comida um mais criativo que o outro. Não só os bichinhos possuem nome e design únicos mas a forma variada de capturar eles torna a jogabilidade bem leve e divertida. Como não existem batalhas, como em Pokémon, você tem várias ferramentas para usar dependendo do bugsnax-alvo. Você vai querer ser sorrateiro para capturar uma maçã siri (massiri) para que ela não fuja antes de você colocar a armadilha ou vai precisar usar um arpão pra capturar um mosquito uva (mosquituva) em pleno ar mas corra bem rápido se um besouro hamburguer (burguesouro) furioso vier na sua direção. Admito, me diverti muito tentando completar minha Pokedex, quero dizer, minha Bugapedia.

Outro ponto alto do jogo são os NPCs que vivem na ilha com você, são todos tão carismáticos e cheios de personalidade que com certeza vão te marcar mesmo após o fim. Algo que contribui muito pra isso eh o sistema de relacionamento que esses personagens possuem entre si que, apesar de ser bem simples, torna tudo muito vivo e orgânico. Cada personagem gosta ou odeia outro(s) e isso faz você entender melhor como eles são e evidencia ainda mais a personalidade única de cada um, além de criar situações muito divertidas.

Em questão de história ele não falha também conseguindo trazer um bom mistério para ser resolvido e uma boa progressão. A exploradora Lizbert convida você, um jornalista investigativo, a visitar uma ilha misteriosa onde existem esses inseto-comida (ateh então um mito) mas chegando lá você descobre que sua anfitriã está desaparecida e que todos os outros habitantes se dispersaram pela ilha agora que não possuem mais um líder. Para descobrir o que houve e encontrar a Lizbert você pode explorar toda a ilha para encontrar pistas deixadas para trás além de realizar entrevistas com os moradores como um bom detetive. Talvez no caminho você consiga descobrir o que são e de onde vem essas comidas ambulante e pode ser que encontre uma forma de voltar para casa. Ou não.

No geral Bugsnax eh um excelente jogo que diverte bastante, tem uma boa duração e uma gameplay descontraída e suficientemente complexa, com certeza consegue prender do começo ao fim.
 
Giocourt

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
15.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 juillet 2022
Bugsnax - part bug, part snack, 100% cuteness.

На милом острове живут милые зверушки - похожие на жуков и на еду одновременно (бургер с лапками из картошки-фри! бегающая киви с ложкой в носу! летающая пицца моцарелла!). Их можно ловить сачком, капканом, всяческими липкими и ловкими приспособлениями, как особо продвинутых покемонов. А потом выпускать на волю на здешнюю ферму.

На милом острове живут милые туристы-исследователи. Вместо людей тут цивилизация Грампусов - смешных пушистых двуногих, похожих на Маппетов из одноименного шоу, еще на героев Улицы Сезам и немного на клыкастых моржеленивцев. Грампусы возделывают грядки с кетчупом, ссорятся, мирятся, изобретают безумные машины. Еще им можно скармливать вышеупомянутых зверушек - Bugsnaks. Багснеки (жуконямки в переводе) - совершенно бестолковые, непонятно как работающие вообще (ни мозга, ни скелета, один... бургер), но очень вкусные существа. Кажется, экспедиция на Snaktooth Island совершенно случайно открыла рай на земле.

Бегаем за багснеками, ловим багснеков, заносим в коллекционный альбом на тему catch'em all, делаем ненапряжные квесты и решаем загадки. Расслабление, наслаждение, всепроникающий кавай.

BUT WAIT THIS IS ACTUALLY A HORROR GAME.

Не шучу, тэг psychological horror игре поставлен заслуженно. В принципе, можно довольно быстро начать подозревать: что-то неладно и с островом, и с жукоедой. А по мере раскрытия сюжета, плюс ДЛС... Ой вей. Уберите слабонервных матерей от наших голубых экранов. Детей оставьте, детям может понравиться.

Подробно распространяться про Bugsnax - сплошные спойлеры, скажу лишь, что покемонский процесс "поймай их всех" ужасно затягивающ и азартен, можно часами носиться по острову, собирая зверушек и выполняя задания-ачивки. Зверушки разнообразны, забавны, приманиваются на кетчуп и прочие соусы, взаимодействуют друг с другом - целая экосистема! А местные НПС-Грампусы (наш ГГ - тоже Грампус, конечно) очаровательны и запоминаются сходу. На пойманных и посаженных в клетку багснеков можно надевать смешные шляпы.

Бонус: дают собственный домик, который можно обставлять, упорото и уютно. (Мебель - все за те же квесты.) Cozy!

Kinda bug and kinda snack
Try to catch 'em in your trap
Feed somebody and you'll see:
We are whatever we eat

Find 'em hiding in the sand
Tearing up a ketchup patch
Come to Snaktooth Island and discover:
It's Bugsnax!
 
Wolfox

Évaluation publiée le 19 juin 2022
Follow my curator page for more 100% reviews!

(All Achievements Review)

About

Originally slated for exclusivity on the PS5, the Steam release of Bugsnax reintroduces us to the creators who once concocted Octodad, a title that exists in a similar conduit to this one when referencing Young Horses' whimsical but dark sense of humor. With an unusual premise & a themed score provided by Kero Kero Bonito, Bugsnax is guaranteed to invoke a feeling of curiosity, if nothing else. The game transpires in first-person, from the viewpoint of a journalist who is never named or shown & allows a singular customization option: the color of your fur. As a member of the Grumpus race, your destiny is to exert yourself in the field as an investigative reporter. With inadvertence to the commonly upheld silent protagonist trope, what remains of the cast (alongside the organisms themselves) is both fully & convincingly voice acted.

Amid your adventure on Snaktooth Island, you'll engage in the pursuit & capture of the game's namesake: bugsnax. Bugsnax are half-arthropod, half-snack creatures that assume the appearance of a myriad of different foods, the range fluctuating by size & method of transportation. The most substantial of these undertake the form of multiple-course meals, often capable of being separated into several components.

Scoopy Banoopy (a banana split comprised of ice cream and cherries) & the Preying Picantis (assorted Mexican foods, such as Tacroaches and Incherritos), are just two examples of these. In the averagely proportioned tier, you'll confront Flutterjams (airborne PB&J sandwiches), Spuddies (baked potatoes that exist in two variants, simplistic and loaded), & Bungers (plainly put, a wrapped burger coupled with fries), although there are more. Lastly, the miniature category embodies select rations, particularly provisions like Scorpenyos (Jalapeño scorpions), Snakpods (tiny, stationary, & rectangular bags of trail mix, jerky, pretzels, and so on), Noodlers (spicy Japanese ramen bowls), & fast-paced Kwookies (Oreos with legs), in addition to significantly more. 

There are, of course, various legendaries to quarrel with; (spoiler warning) like the Mothza Supreme (an Icarian pizza topped off w/ pepperoni, black olives, & cheese), who you'll convene with whilst tackling the scorching heat of the Sizzling Sands, the oversized Megamaki (a draconic sushi roll) inhabiting the Boiling Bay, & the Cheddaboardle Rex, who materializes in the DLC. Obviously, there are a few more bosses in tandem w/ these three, but you'll discern that info near the finale of your playthrough. (Spoiler ending.) 

There are over 100 species of bugsnax to collect if you're counting the DLC, which comes free with your purchase of the game. Don't allow the notion of this to overwhelm you, because this game is a perfect experience for someone seeking an ephemeral & pleasant encounter. Bugsnax necessitates about 10 to 25 hours to reach completion, with the second figure representing 100%. 

While you're helping out the community that arrived here prior to you, you'll be well-qualified to form bonds with distinctly dissimilar characters, absorb data concerning their unique personalities, & assist them with their individual troubles. Commit crimes with Cromdo Face, the pragmatic businessman with a laser-eye focus on his monetary gain; scrutinize Snaxburg's residents with Beffica Winklesnoot; mediate the marriage disputes of Wambus Troubleham (the farmer desperately trying to provide sustenance for civilization) & Triffany Lottablog (an aloof archaeologist with a nihilistic streak), or witness the queer romance between Chandlo Funkbun (the town's resident himbo gym bro) & Snorpy Fizzlebean (a scientific conspiracy theorist that frequently goes off the rails). Regardless of who you converse with, it's possible to locate one's self in an array of admiration, irritability, and melancholy. 

In your possession, there will be a journal that drastically reduces time spent on logistics, rendering it feasible to track your progress. This includes a section for side quests, lore involving new companions, a bestiary that even lists caloric intake, & the rest will be discovered during your run.

Sift through the remnants of your tools at your discretion, uncovering animalistic traps, a springboard that's known as the "Lunchpad," a puzzling apparatus referred to as the "Snaktivator" (which was designed by Flooty Fizzlebean, Snorpy's sibling and a stereotypically unethical scientist), the Buggy Ball (a clear hamster ball with a trained Strabby called Sprout encased inside), amongst many others. Whether you'd elect to use these contraptions by themselves or in combination with each other, there will always be innumerable available methods to ensnare the food that you supply the people of Snaxburg with.

Snaktooth Island has a variety of distinguished biomes to survey, attingent with plenty of endemic vegetation. Since the character you control "happens" to be allergic to bugsnax, you instead survive on sauce plants. Weenyworms (literal squirming hotdogs) are heavily dependent on ketchup; the critters living in the tundra-based habitat of Sugarpine Woods & Frosted Peak gravitate towards peanut butter; & the Pineantulas (a pineapple tarantula) & Crapples (apple-laden crustaceans) of the tropical beach cove labeled Simmering Springs prefer chocolate sauce, just to list a few cases. There are seven distinct condiments that you're able to utilize as bait with your trusty Sauce Slinger, in conjunction with hot sauce and cheese, accompanying grasslands, deserts, snowy mountains, & the foundation of a volcano. 

Abandon All Hope, Ye Who Enter

Your journey begins on the precipice of a breakthrough; the intrepid explorer Elizabert Megafig (who can only be compared to a Grumpus-tinged manifestation of Indiana Jones) invites you to Snaktooth Island through the chassis of sepia-hued video tapes. Even though your editor seems overly pessimistic, she bestows the knowledge that Elizabert is a woman who has a rocky history, having previously been involved with some sort of hoax. Despite this realization imbuing Elizabert's basis with skepticism, you heed her summons anyway.

(Spoilers again.) After making an entrance indicative of a negative omen, you'll meet a fellow Grumpus known as Filbo Fiddlepie who appears to be on the brink of death. Following learning how to apprehend bugsnax through a brief in-game tutorial, you'll dose Filbo w/ this unfamiliar food source. Subsequently, the game began to exude a sinister quality. Disregarding a typical digestive process, bugsnax' alternatively induces the growth of regenerative edible limbs in place of their former ones, which regretfully prompted me to envision the consequences of radioactivity in earlier titles such as Fallout. The mutations turn Grumpuses into mangled desecrations of their past selves, & the most insidious part of it, in totality, is the uncritical acceptance that permeates the air. The sole one seeming to protest this phenomenon is Shelda, a spiritualistic guru who likens bugsnax to toxins. One of the academic researchers in town eventually goes so far as to coin this irregularity as "Snakification".

Others may not notice at initial glance... However, I found the game to be creepy. There is room for other emotions, but the alarm bells ring perpetually in the background.

(Spoiler #2 conceding.) 

Final Thoughts

This rendition of the game permits controller support (which entails DualSense) & ran at a smooth 58–60 FPS for me on ultra graphical settings. I'm using a laptop containing 16GB of RAM, an RTX 2070, & an i7-9700 Intel Core, & I didn't come across any glitches, but there are a plethora of bugs, if you catch my drift. If you're a fan of Pokémon, you might appreciate this.

Capt. Bongo
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2022
Now, let me tell you, the plot-twist scared the knickers off of me. Bugsnax, oh Bugsnax, it may seem like a lighthearted snack-filled adventure at first glance, but don't let that fool you. Behind its charming facade lies a mysterious tale that will leave you questioning everything you thought you knew.

Set foot on the enigmatic Snaktooth Island, where half-bug, half-snack creatures roam free. But there's more to these Bugsnax than meets the eye. As you delve deeper into the game, you'll uncover a web of secrets, hidden agendas, and twists that will make your head spin like a grape soda tornado.

The island's inhabitants are a peculiar bunch, each with their own agenda and peculiar quirks. They'll guide you through their peculiar requests to catch Bugsnax, but don't be fooled by their seemingly innocent appetites. There's an underlying darkness that looms over Snaktooth Island, and the more Bugsnax you encounter, the more the truth unravels.

The gameplay itself is a curious blend of puzzle-solving and creature-catching. You'll need to use your wits and the gadgets at your disposal to outsmart these delectable critters. But beware, for every Bugsnax you capture, you'll be drawn deeper into a world where reality and fantasy intertwine, and the consequences of your actions become harder to digest.

Visually, Bugsnax is a vibrant and surreal experience. The mix of adorable snack-like creatures and the island's captivating landscapes creates an otherworldly atmosphere that will keep you on the edge of your seat. The art style is a feast for the eyes, with a perfect balance of whimsy and unease.

However, it's the narrative that truly sets Bugsnax apart. As you uncover the island's secrets, you'll question the very nature of your own existence. What are these Bugsnax? Where do they come from? And what is their true purpose? The answers lie within the shadows, waiting for intrepid explorers like yourself to discover.

So, if you're brave enough to venture into the peculiar world of Bugsnax, be prepared for a mind-bending journey filled with delightful surprises and unsettling revelations. This is not your average snack-filled adventure; it's a mysterious odyssey that will keep you guessing until the very end. Let Bugsnax take you on a twisted and deliciously puzzling ride, where the truth lies beneath the surface, waiting to be devoured.
 
_Odin_

20.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 aout 2022
Bugsnax is absolutely fantastic.

It comes across as this cute and fun game which it is! All the characters are so likeable and interacting with each of them is really interesting.
When interacting you get to explore so much about each of them which I really enjoy. They'll take you on their own side quests but then also make you do small tasks just to help develop their character. Throughout the whole story you get to see the different relationships that form and all the characters interacting with each other.

The bugsnax are such a clever and cute idea. It was so nice going to each area and discovering the many variations of them and trying to connect them with the real world food we have. Similar to pokemon they say their own name but they're just super cute. Sometimes you feel bad about catching them.

The whole game is just so well made. the artstyle is super appealing with the bright colours it forms this friendly feel across the whole game. A lot of the story caught me by surprise especially the ending which I won't spoil.


I really recommend this. Probably one of my favourite games of the year!

Évaluation publiée le 28 décembre 2023
Bugsnax is probably one of my favorite games to have been released in the last couple of years. When i saw the trailer i got instant viva pinata vibes from it even if the gameplay isnt near the same. I got really excited by that because viva pinata is one of my favorite games ever and i grew up no lifeing it. this game is similar in the graphical style. How there are puzzles to get certain creatures and you can "Tame" in a sense the creatures. They all say their names which is pokemon esc and even more nostalgia feeling. But the game was really fun to play and beat. The story is you basically go to this island of food creatures, Trying to figure out what happened to the great explorer Lizbert. I was very pleased with this game and very pleased with its story. Its goofy and the acting is bad at times but its a cute great little game. I would probably give the game an 8/10 and completion of it a nice 7/10. It's a little tedious but it wasnt bad getting everything. Anyways I would recommend this game to someone who wants a great casual experience. Also, Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger Bunger.

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
32.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2022
无论是画风还是玩法还是世界观都非常戳我的一款游戏，玩着玩着就在想上辈子我是修了什么福分才在这辈子遇到这么棒的一个游戏（可能含有夸张但不完全夸张

画风上，爬行扭动的可爱零食虫虫完美戳中我的轻微猎奇癖好和不存在的少女心耶（？）。看着这么多好好吃的零食扭啊扭爬啊爬飞呀飞真的很难不心动不是吗…而且每一只虫虫都有超级超级可爱又超级超级洗脑的配音！！玩完后好久好久脑内都在被各种虫虫的叫声洗脑。bungerbungerbungerbunger...

玩法上，差不多就是想方设法地捕捉你遇到的每一只习性各异的零食虫虫。后期用来狩猎虫虫的道具越来越多之后，许多捕捉方法都不会是唯一解。无论是利用道具组合还是利用地形还是利用别的零食虫还是利用自己我就喜欢把自己点着了往冰冻的虫虫身上扑，效果拔群 ，最终都可以达到目的，可以说是条条大路通罗马。靠自己探索出一套属于自己的狩猎方法之后是真的很有成就感！！而且本作可以说是完全没有失败惩罚，玩家是没有血条的，遇到的危险顶多是被零食虫虫撞飞或者暂时点燃或者暂时冻住或者被吹飞，就算是boss战也有无数次可以试错的机会，虽然很多地方都有较为明显的游戏内提示给你提供一种可行的解法，但也可以放心大胆地去尝试自己的每一个天马行空的想法！虽然是很容易的游戏但也不缺乏一些必要的挑战性，真的很容易让人上头啊。jpg（真正的挑战性还是一些邮件任务，但无论是完成游戏流程甚至是达成全成就都不要求把邮件任务全完成，算是可以选择性挑战的一些进阶玩法了x
并且游戏有一条明显且完整的主线，引导做得也不错，不用担心会突然不知道该做些什么。但在主线以外也有很多内容可供探索，提供了很高的自由度（比如不想做主线的时候把见到的所有虫虫都抓一下或是做一些支线或是收集一些虫虫帽子或是肝一些邮件任务或是去尝试发现一些游戏里的秘密都是极好的x（所以这游戏是真的真的上头

世界观上，说实话把虫子喂给咕噜包们（就是游戏里的npc啦）就能让他们的身体发生变化这个设定，细想真的很掉san对不对…（但是我喜欢） [有结局剧透→] 虽然最后也说了这确实就是一种寄生虫啦，甚至能让大家都嗑嗨，没错岛上的咕噜包们就是嗑零食虫嗑嗨了（确信）
我觉得做得很好甚至令我惊喜的是你遇到的每一个咕噜包的性格塑造几乎都让人印象深刻，甚至还有超级走心的全配音！哪怕在村子里闲逛也会遇见他们主动向你打招呼！或是他们之间也会互相打招呼聊天…这种细节真的能增加很多参与感！逐渐了解每一个人，逐渐和大家加深羁绊，理解每个人各自的执念和痛处…（甚至还能嗑cp，百合男酮都很香香) 每个咕噜包对应的支线剧情，最终都是一场与自己的和解，看着他们的成长虽然说不上是有多深刻吧，但至少肯定有让人感动或是予人启发的地方。十分推荐去尝试做完每一条支线。

最后谢谢你看到这里，希望都能和我一样享受这个超棒的游戏！！
 
Titlark

Évaluation publiée le 25 novembre 2022
《Bugsnax》是一个轻量级的益智冒险游戏，因为它强大的故事和人物设定，可以让我直到游戏结束都很享受游戏的过程。尽管游戏中有一些简单的难题，但笑声明显多于抱怨，因为我惊讶地发现自己对岛上和岛上居民发生的事情投入了太多时间。游戏中有超过100个Bugsnax需要发现和捕捉，让游戏有了丰富的乐趣和完成度，还有那些一心想要制作一个六个小时的好故事，让你直到游戏结束都在猜个不停的人。所有这一切都让你与角色产生了情感上的联系，这是你以前可能认为听起来不可能的，直到你玩到这个游戏。

43 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
37.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2022
Bugsnax - игра для настоящих гигачадов
Геймплейно прикольная игра про жанглирование своими инструментами в попытках найти и поймать разных жуконямок. ГГ у нас журналист, поэтому он также берёт интервью у нпс, что правда несёт только сюжетную нагрузку. Есть задания на "шпионаж", не требующие ничего кроме ожидания до опр. момента внутриигрового времени. А также квесты именно на поимку определённых жуконямок, они составляют подавляющую часть Bugsnax. Игра не особо длинная (сюжетка - ~12ч, длс - 1ч, 100% - 16-18ч), а потому прям сильно надоесть они не успевают. А, ещё есть mail квесты. Это как бы обычные сайдквесты, но которые вы получаете из почтового ящика и вот уже они порой достаточно интересные (если не фрустрирующие). Например, подстроить и сфотографировать какую-нибудь ситуацию с жуконямками.
Игру часто сравнивают с Slime Rancher, чем не повод растянуть обзор обсудить и это. И там и там, вы бродите по разным локациям и изучаете их; и там и там, вы ищете разных зверушек, но в слайм ренчер упор на симулятор беготни по ферме, а здесь скорее про разные подходы к, опять же, поимке нямок. Ну и истории здесь больше конечно, + если там вас двигает ваше же исследование локаций, то здесь скорее задания нпс.

Музыка классная. Ну не то чтобы классная настолько что к ней я смог подобрать аж 2 слова, ноооооо... поверьте наслово короче.

Локации разные, даже подчиняются правилам метроидваний, имея собственную цветовую палитру, климат, уникальные природные явления и собственную живность.

Но есть и минусы, конечно
  • Финал. сюжетно он хорош, неожиданный твист, напряжение, всё такое. Но вот геймплейно он очень скучный. Вам нужно просто отбиться от волн врагов, используя модифицированные версии устройств что у вас уже есть. Ещё раз, они у вас уже есть и есть долго. а инструментов всего 6. и каждая волна отбивается за минуту-две. И поверьте, это реально успевает надоесть.

  • Локализация. Прекрасная, понятия не имею как, кто и зачем её сделал. каламбуры в названиях жуконямок адаптированы отлично, понятно что работа проделана большая, но не без минусов. Во первых, обращается игра ко всем нпс и к игроку в женском роде. во вторых, есть как минимум одно место, где недопереведена строчка в одном задании. да, прям огромнейший минус.
Как-то так. Милая игра про поиск уникальных подходов к ловле жуконямок, почти без огрехов. Мне понравилось, и Вам советую
9/10, получается наверное

спасибо за внимание
 
pyoh1988
128 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 juin 2023
Сразу скажу - игра мне скорее понравилась, чем нет. Она милая, каждый встреченный НПС обладает своим запоминающимся характером, озвучка жуконямок просто ми-ми-ми. И если вам нравятся коллектафоны (игры вроде "Покемон", где нужно собирать различных животин), то BugSnax вполне себе достойный представитель.

Для себя из минусов прежде всего отметил низкую сложность игры. То, что для других может стать, напротив, решающим положительным фактором - это отличная казуальная игра для расслабления, с почти несуществующими наказаниями за неудачи. Я в эту струю уже не так чтобы попадаю, мне не хватило перчинки.
Далее. В игре приличное разнообразие животин, особенно после выхода бесплатного обновления. Увы, и здесь не обошлось без ложки дёгтя - некоторые из них это всего лишь рескины самих себя. Скажем, есть простой скорперец, а есть горящий. Да, второго так просто не захватишь - он сжигает всевозможные ловушки, поэтому требуется особь сначала потушить. Но это всё тот же зверь, с теми же повадками, просто чуть улучшенный. Есть дневная сырная бабочка, а есть ночной вариант... Леденцы-стрекозы так вообще в трёх вариантах представлены, а разница между ними разве что в биомах обитания! К счастью, 80-90% жуконямок всё же уникальны, и это радует, но всё же.

Чрезмерное обилие заданий в почтовом ящике от новообретённых друзей. По большей части, достаточно скучных заданий из разряда "поймай 8 жуконямок с шоколадом в их составе - и скорми мне". Таких заданий несколько десятков, и они быстро надоедают. Не столь сложно понять какие ингредиенты нужны, сколько убивает необходимость бегать заново по локациям. В смысле, да, это игра про ловлю коллектаблсов, но вы не хотите собирать те же самые коллектаблсы ПОВТОРНО в тех же местах. Не знаю зачем разработчики решили растягивать игру *таким образом*, интерес от новизны столько не держится. Для желающих пройти все задания на 100% это может стать предбанником ада, остальные же пойдут по сюжету и минуют сию участь.
К слову, наградой за эти задания выступают предметы-украшения для дома протагониста. Дом построят для нас и ЗА нас, нам разрешат только кастомизировать всяческие раскраски, занавески, расставлять предметы мебели по заготовленным слотам. И любоваться, потому что больше никакой игровой ценности жилище не несёт. Даже спать для перемотки времени суток при желании можно в любой другой кровати. Но есть и ладно, нейтральная совершенно фича для меня, а кого-то вдруг порадует.

Если сконцентрироваться только на сюжете, игра окажется короткой. Не то чтобы это было плохо - BugSnax осыпает игрока порцией новых ощущений, а затем приглашает двигаться дальше. Добавьте сюда ещё пару часов дополнения, которое требуется проходить до окончания официальной истории, и получите нормальное приключение, балансирующее между "крепким середняком" и оценкой "хорошо, но...", которое вы едва ли в скором времени решите перепроходить, но однозначно будете помнить яркие моменты из него.
 
Sevenecho

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
25.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 juillet 2023
Insel Urlaub. Essensinsekten. Grumpusse.

Als Journalist fliegst du zu einer Insel, um die Entdeckerin der sogenannten Bugsnax zu interviewen. Insekten, die aussehen und schmecken wie geiles Essen. Da aber wieder alles anders kommt, als es geplant war, ist der Job als Handlanger grade frei geworden.

Schöne Storyline, unterschiedliche Charaktere, viele Nebenquests und noch mehr Mailquests.
Es gibt viel zu tun. Viele Bugsnax zu fangen mit unterschiedlichen Werkzeugen, Grumpussen helfen, Aufgaben erfüllen, seine Hütte dekorieren und im besten Falle noch seinen Job richtig machen.
Achievements sind auch gut zu bekommen, keine krass zeitintensiven oder komplizierten Sachen.
Für die kompletten 100%, mit allem drum und dran, kommt man gut auf die 24-30+h.

Ich hatte auf jeden Fall sehr viel Spaß und kann es nur
empfehlen. ♡

21.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2023
I was lured in by the contrast of the tags versus the art and had extremely low expectations but I'm having a grand ole time. There was a point where I think the game could have ended (I was given a warning I couldn't catch more snacks if I accepted a quest, not sure if it was a pause or indefinite) and, because I was actually interested in the idea of 100%ing the catches, I didn't pursue it and was rewarded by a quest that unlocked an entirely new area. I'm not someone who is usually interested in achievements but hot damn I'm having fun. I do not think the tags are apt, like elements are present but they do not represent gameplay at all, but if that lures you for the sheer hilarity of it, go for it as you may be pleasantly surprised.

Évaluation publiée le 22 janvier 2023
Bugasnax é um jogo incrivelmente engraçado e cativante! A ideia de capturar insetos com comida é genial e a jogabilidade é incrivelmente divertida.

Personagens e cenários coloridos e animados. A trilha sonora é contagiante e adiciona ainda mais ao clima divertido do jogo.

A história é engraçada e envolvente, com um enredo que se desenrola de forma natural e mantém o jogador preso ao jogo desde o início até o final. A jogabilidade é incrível, com uma variedade de armas e itens disponíveis, o que permite ao jogador se adaptar às diferentes situações e desafios.

Bugasnax é o tipo de jogo que você não consegue parar de jogar. E se você gosta de insetos deliciosos, então você vai amar ainda mais!

Bugsnax, how do I love thee?
Let me munch through the ways.
I love thee to the depth and breadth and height
A Flutterjam can reach, when evading capture
For the ends of being and ideal grace.
I love thee to the calorie count of Weenyworm,
By garden grove and simmering sands.
I love thee freely, as Grumpuses strive for snacks.
I love thee purely, as Gramble tends his flock
I love thee with the passion
put to use by Wambus and his cactus.
I love thee with a love Triffany seemed to lose
As she went to the desert to find herself.
I love thee with the reps,
Sets, and cycles, of all Chandlo's life;
and, if Bunger choose,
I shall but love thee better after lunch.

Recommandé
30.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 septembre 2023
It took me somewhere around 30 hours to complete the game and its included free DLC, The Isle of Bigsnax. It has quite a lot of content for such a simple premise. The characters are charming with distinct personalities and mannerisms, and the voice acting is professional and done by some incredible names in the industry, including Yuri Lowenthal, Roger Craig Smith, and Debra Wilson. The music is fun and very fitting, and I never felt like it wore on me.

If you're a fan of interesting creature designs, creature collection games, endearing characters, or any combination of the above, definitely give this game a try!

Pig
2,860 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
31.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2023
This has gotta be one of the most underrated indie games ever.

Think of it as Legend of Zelda meets Pokemon meets Veggie Tales with an undertone of body horror throughout. The writing and voice acting are fantastic and there's a surprising amount of depth to the gameplay in terms of figuring out how to combine mechanics in order to catch the more unwieldy bugsnax. Regarding difficulty, it's "easy" in the sense that you don't have health/there's no real consequences for failure, however, there's a lot of optional content that offers a moderate challenge to your puzzle-solving skills and timing ability if you're up for that.

I won't spoil the story, but tonally it manages to be funny (I legitimately lol'd a few times), wholesome (the characters are fully fleshed out and you actually care about their fate), and delightfully bizarre (I wondered at several moments what kind of person would come up with a concept like this and somehow convince others to help them execute it fully) all at once. Anyway, that's all to say that Bugsnax is definitely a new fave of mine and I could totally see it becoming a cult classic in the future.

Btw, if you're worried about price, there's at least 25 hrs. of content here if you do most of the optional quests/areas, so imo at $25 you're definitely getting your money's worth. Notice how high the completion rates are on the achievements, most of which aren't main story-related. That should be proof enough that you won't want to stop playing this game until you've finished all the silly little side quests and captured every goofy-a$$ looking bugsnack there is.
 
chelle <3

bunger my beloved
 
coconut doggy
531 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2022
Bugsnax is... surprising. What it is. is a game about catching bugs that look like snacks. But what it really is, is a mystery game about a missing person (sorry, Grumpus). But ACTUALLY, what it really is, is a game with a deep historical mystery. But really, though, what it truly is, is a game about goofy muppet people who all have goals and relationships being challenged by negative core beliefs about themselves, and your journey to help them overcome the obstacles within and achieve self actualization. But for real, though, what it really really is, is a game about Sandopedes and putting launchers under them so they break into little bits of sandwich that fly everywhere.

This is a bafflingly captivating game with great characters, clever writing, and excellent voice actors all under the guise of a silly children's game. The story is engaging, there's several fun mysteries to be solved, there are tons of Bugsnax to catch (each requiring cleverly using your tools in different combinations to get them), and it's just straight-up fun.

While the tag labeled "psychological horror" is not exactly lying, you will not be frightened by this game. There are no jumpscares or outright horror elements here, though if you have a good, hard think about some of the secrets you'll uncover in your time on the island, it will definitely provoke some creepy ideas and there are a few underlying mysteries with some surprisingly dark connotation--WITH THAT SAID, this is a peaceful, chill game. It's not very difficult (it's more about puzzling things out than having quick reflexes), it's got a really relaxing atmosphere, it is played all at your own pace, you're free to explore anywhere you go, and there are plenty of funny and wholesome moments to even things out. I found myself laughing often with the dialogue.

I'm not yet fully through my first playthrough, but nearing the end at around 13 hours of playtime. I do plan to 100% this game, though, as it's such a great way to unwind in the evenings. Overall, I was really surprised by the emotional spectrum that this game explores and just how much authenticity is buried under such an absurd and silly concept. I was also surprised at just how much fun this game ended up being. It even runs beautifully on Linux. This is an easy recommend.
 
Grumpy Spice
1,538 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0

Recommandé
31.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2022
I played this on PS4 and have been burning through this. Some of the objectives on the requests (I'm looking at YOU, Triffany, with your item on the mountain top) are a bit tricky, and I ran into an invisible wall a lot of the specific one I mentioned. Otherwise, they're pretty good and have both challenging and easy requests to do. I have yet to touch the Island, I will update when I get through with it, but it feels fun and the hints of Shelda backstory are making me very VERY curious.

EDIT: As of playing through the DLC, this was an excellent expansion to the existing game and I love that it hints at more. I wonder if there will be more DLC where we answer the lingering questions of Broken Tooth Island.

yamato
169 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
17.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2022
Bugsnax is a game that upfront appeals to the completionist urge to catch a variety of stupid, but cute, looking food creatures. I figured the game would consist of catching stuff to fill up a book of checkmarks and nothing more...

What caught me off guard is how genuinely immersed I got into the world of Bugsnax. The various characters you meet are written shockingly well, discussing a lot of complex themes that feel almost out of place for such a stupid-looking game. There's also a really good sense of mystery to the island you explore. Not a whole lot is explained at first and you feel like an outsider messing with forces you do not fully understand.

Sure would be shame if that had horrific ramifications in the future. Strabby supremacy!
 
Dragonova
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé

Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2022
Kinda Bug Kinda Snack
Bunger is The Best Character Ever Created. He is Beyond Mortal Comprehension, A Simple Human Such As Myself Can Not Explain The Raw Emotion I Feel Upon Seeing Him. The Thought of Going a Day Without Bunger Makes Me Shiver Because That Would Be a Cold Day in Hell When I Allow That to Happen.
I Need Him, I Need Bunger
 
Sam
471 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
82.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 mai 2022
Man, I wasn't expecting to enjoy this game as much as I did. You go about catching bugsnaxs with a variety of gadgets and tactics. Some harder to catch than others. The puzzles are well put together and are the right amount of challenge for a causal gamer that's looking for a relaxing game that won't put you to sleep. The bugsnaxs themselves are obviously the highlight of the game. I don't know how they managed to make a taco roach look so cute, but they did. The characters you comes across are enjoyable with their own emotional baggage. I would have liked if they delved into some of the characters a bit more. Some of the them got more attention than others in development. Overall, Bugsnax is a cute and happy game until it isn't. ;3

Pleasantries Before [...]
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 juillet 2022
Bugsnax is a cute bug collect-a-thon where you hang out with a group of misfits on a mysterious island. Using a wide variety of traps and tools, your goals are to catch them all and use those caught Snax in order to complete quests and unlock more and more of the island and more people to hang out in your village.
Bugsnax is also a horror-lite. The creatures have the effect of transforming anyone that eats them, giving the game a light cover of body horror, and the further into the game you get, the more the horrifying truth of Snaktooth comes to light. Each person that lives in the village also has their own issues, from depression and anxiety, to not being able to bring back the old days, to feeling like they'll fail at everything they do, and the sidequests both touch on those topics and help put some resolution in them.
If you can handle a bit of body horror, unsettling truths, watching cute furry critters discussing heavy topics, and don't mind a gameplay loop that consists of figuring out what tools you need to use to catch the critters in this game, I highly recommend giving this game a try. At the time of writing this, I have caught every single Bugsnax, completed every sidequest, satisfied every request, unlocked every achievement, and even finished the Isle of Bigsnax free expansion.
 
Artix Fox

20.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mai 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

I love just about everything about this game. It was originally described as a psychological horror to me, which I won't go into details but it fits to an extent. It's not really a "scary" psychological horror, though, so don't be put off by that. The vibes throughout the game are chill and there's quite a bit to do even if there is a lot of bugsnak catching.
 
HexWyn
773 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 décembre 2022
Sempre ouvi bem desse jogo e tipo entendia que havia algo a mais que ser um pokemon Snap, mas não pensei que iria curtir tanto assim o jogo por coisas fora do que você vê no trailer

Jogo tem um grupo de personagem super carismáticos, eles começam bem genéricos e melhoram muito durante o gameplay, mostrando até assuntos sérios como anxiedade e depressão ou achar que é um problema pros outros

O jogo começa bem simples e fácil nas capturas dos Bugsnax mas vai complicando e tem até alguns BOSS battles bem legais é bem grandinho pra um indie game e com várias coisas para fazer e coletar

Você entende que tem algo de errado e o jogo da uma vibe de Tá Chovendo Hamburguer 2 e me lembrou bastante o filme

Ele é o tipo de jogo que parece para crianças mas ele é feito pensando mesmo na galera mais velha

Uma excelente representação de casais LGBT no jogo, fiquei impressionado na química e nos dialogos não tem como não dar os parabéns para os Devs

Recomendo fácil é divertido, bem completo e se tiver um 2 compro no lançamento

NOTA 9/10

Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2022
So I completed 100% of the acheavments and have to say- I LOVED IT! Although the game sometimes was a bit laggy in the late game, it didn't significantly impact the experience. For me I got 100% in my first playthough, though i needed help from some gydes. No shame in that! The story is fun with dark undertones and really enjoyable. Though the darkness stays in the backround and that is what makes it great! There isn't some mid playthrough sudden twist, but a slow buildup. where you have look for more by yourself!
 
kleo_the_bread_roll

0
Recommandé
31.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

Great game to have- I was gifted it, and it is honestly so adorable that even when you finish the game, you find yourself wondering through it, completing achievements and not caring about what you know. I also recommend the free DLC- Adds a new boss, 11 new bugsnax and a whole new item. I would Highly recommend this to someone who enjoys adventure games, or else wants a calming but fun experience. Some may say it's a little like pokemon- and yes, in one view, it could be. But it adds entirely new mechanics and puts a spin on it's wonderful, creative nature. This is a perfectly made game.

A cute little collect-a-thon with some bite. The DLC is nice, but there wasn't too much reward for 100%ing the side-missions etc.

Also, the game has Bunger in it, so 10/10. But they won't let me date Filbo so 0/10.

Évaluation publiée le 28 mars 2023
This game is, what I consider, a toy with a storyline, the mechanics allow you to complete some missions with complete made up strategies due to the versatility of the tools (Kinda SPOILER i guess, I could catch a Sandapede before obtaining the tripshot).
Is really fun to figure out the best strategies for capturing snax.
The psychological horror tag is an exaggeration, but as a drama-driven adventure game it excels.

Recommandé
14.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 juillet 2022
I was walking my dog and my 8-year old neighbor started telling me about his new favorite video game, Bugsnax. On a whim I searched it up, and with the "Overwhelmingly positive" reviews, I had to give it a try. It does not disappoint! It's kind of like first person pokemon, but less grindy, better balanced puzzles, and amazing story-line and voice acting. All with some really creepy overtones.

Non recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2023
First I had fun in the time i played but I don’t think it is worth my time any more since I didn’t vibe as much as I usually do with other games.

The initial novelty was interesting and the story made me interested too but that was it and for me it is not enough.

The core gameplay consisting of catching bugs and building traps is slow, and the controls, they don’t feel intuitive to me, I had to think about the controls from time to time.

The graphic’s style could be a bit different but also they are kinda funny.

In the end it is fun but slow and for me I’ve had it enough after 45 minutes of playtime

Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
I just finished bugsnax and it honestly has some of the best characters in a video game ever for me, although its a very silly game with a very silly story, it was still a very good gaming experience because of the dialogue and how each character had flaws and strengths and you got to build connections with each one and you got to see them interact with others and repair their bonds. Honestly so amazing. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a solid game with great characters.

kuma
181 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
33.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 mai 2022
This game was a huge delight to play! At the time of this review I've played through it twice. Once for the first time/casual play-through and then again to experience the story again notice more details and 100% the game entirely. Very easy/do-able completion if you enjoy the gameplay!

At first glance I thought it was like Viva Pinata from the trailers but its actually closer to Pokemon Snap in that each creature is a sort of puzzle to "catch." However, the catching is quite literal, not photos, and you're not stuck on rails like in Snap.

The Traps/Tools and game engine are very well designed so that there isn't only one right answer to catching Bugsnax. You can get pretty creative with your catching methods.

As the player, you're there to figure out the mystery and story behind Bugsnax and Elizabert's (The walrus looking character from the trailer) disappearance and in doing so you also help rebuild a town and help out its denizens.
The characters are all very well written and all have very real depth. Sometimes the conversations get way TOO REAL for a supposed "kids game." Touching on some pretty heavy and serious subjects that many real people actually deal with. The writing really makes you feel for these people and motivates you to help them.

!!! HEY PARENTS AND/OR GUARDIANS !!! - Note the "Psychological Horror" tag -
From my experience this tag seems to only relate to the ending which I won't spoil but I can see how a younger audience could see it as horrifying or even just upsetting. For me personally, the implications of the truth at the ending were more disturbing than what it was at face value. However, even with that said, I feel like I've seen worse in Star Wars or Marvel movies/shows.
 
Jvep420
311 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 septembre 2023
This game really took me by surprise.... it totally wasn't what i was expecting
It take you through this journey where you will learn about each character and their interactions, their pains and fears..... if you take the time for it, it's quite the experience
The ending was also something that gave it quite a twist

All in all, give it a go, it's worth it
(can't say a didn't feel guilty from time to time giving those cute little critters as food)

Recommandé
21.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2022
Sometimes a game comes along that manages to bring an intense amount of creativity, interesting gameplay that ramps up while never becoming exceedingly difficult, and a clever story that gets deeper than your initial perception would lead you to believe.

Bugsnax is one of those games! You will find yourself seeking out every different type of bugsnax you can find, feeling empathy for the different characters and their various plights, and lamenting that the experience doesnt go on longer.

Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2022
An utter delight, from start to finish~
Every Bugsnak is a fun little puzzle to solve in order to catch, every tool you get sees equal use in catching them.
But most shocking is the story. 12 characters, each fully-voiced with questlines that offer complete, and deeply satisfying character arcs. If you love outstanding writing or cute critters, this one is a must-have~

Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2022
Never before has capturing Bugsnax been as immersive as this. I now see why this had to be a PS5 launch title, truly it is very technically demanding with its raytraced Bopsicles and highly detailed Razzbys.

But seriously, play this game. Catching Bugsnax is fun. Characters and dialogue are great.
And the theme song by Kero Kero Bonito?!?!?!? A decade-defining banger.

Unironically 10 / 10 GotY (Grumpus of the Year)

8.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juillet 2022
Solid game. Its kinda like open world, works smoothly, multiple side quests, people to interact with. It definitely has a charm to it. Voice acting is also great.
But, gets a little repetitive with each task just being to collect a bug and feed them but there are a lot of varieties of bugs. Although, there are only 6 (until last mission) ways to collect/trap a bug.
A good recommendation considering it wont take longer than 10hrs to complete it. Maybe couple hours more if going for 100% achievement.

KoloKitten
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
22.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 décembre 2022
Features of Bugsnax:

- There are Bugsnax
- It's beautiful
- Really fantastic
- Better than your favourite game (unless it's already Bugsnax)

There are 112 Bugsnax and they are all beautiful. Some are so cool they even have more versions of them. Some of my favourites are:

- Bunger
We all know it and it's perfect. It loves ketchup so what out and close it carefully or your Bunger WILL destroy your fridge if he smell it during an hungry attack.
!!!WARNING!!!
If your Bunger have chess like pattern then it's not a normal Bunger but a BBQ Bunger, EXTREMELY DANGEROUS!!! It will charge you at sight and no matter how big you are, it will always win

- Instabug
An Ant make of sweets. You always found it take photos and selfie. It have 2 mln followers on Instagram and even run an OnlyFun. Oh come one, you already know that.

- Cellystix
A Stick Bug who is constantly making fun of you, but you probably deserve it. his Rhythm it's out of this world and will keep it no metter what music you put. Whatch out, it can steal your partner on the dancing floor (it did not make it on purpose, it's just irresistible

But watchout among Bugsnax there is a MF

- Cappucceetle
It's cappuccino but belive me you would hate it too. Some of it's flaws are:
Bad mannerism
Broke the things it borrow
it can steal your partner on the dance floor (it DID make it on purpose)
Scrounger and never pay it's debts

Then there are the Grumpus. They are the dominant species on the Bugsnax world. They are furry yet they have more dignity of you. They have gay tendencies (like me fr fr). In the game they are:

- You
- Lara Croft
- Joe Biden
- Lenin
- Twitter egirl
- PETA activist
- Hannah Montana
- Lara Croft remake
- Donald Trump
- GigaChad
- Nicola Tesla
- Dr. Cortex
- Greta Thunberg
- Allison Cameron

Their body changes with the shape of the Bugsnax they ate. Don't ask questions if they ask you a Banopper.

I finished this game at 100%, but then it ended.
 
Kacaronte

Ahora vivo obsesionado ♥♥♥ bichejos de ojos saltarines

Игра прекрасная
Красочная, завораживает количеством жуконямок
Чем-то она мне напомнила Slime Rancher
Но и по потеть приходилось
А именно выполняя побочные квесты в письмах :)
Рекомендую всем фанатам Слаймов
И не смотрите на категорию ЛГБТК+, это есть малость, но этот трюк хорошо преукрашивает сюжет
Видно взаимодействия и близость персонажей
Которые в начале не могли ничего сделать вместе, а под конец соединились в крепость
(｡◕‿‿◕｡)
И прикольно у меня получилось Кромду перевоплотить в ᄽὁȍ ̪ őὀᄿ

Nacho
1,057 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2023
В целом игра понравилась. Для одного прохождения пойдет.
Я люблю такой жанр игр по типу "коллекционирование, ловля?". Похожа на слайм ренчер.

Плюсы:
В Bugsnax нужно ловить монстриков, для каждого нужен свой подход.
Понравились персонажи, озвучка персонажей отличная, музыка зачет.
Не встретил ни одного бага.
Легко выбить все достижения.

Минусы:
Сюжет слабоват. Весь пройденный путь сводиться к тому что: в конце мы просто поболтаем с той, кого искали всю игру и пойти на мини битву. Как по мне, могло быть лучше.
Задания по типу: принеси-подай.
Графика не сказать что выдающаяся.

queengengar2004
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 octobre 2023
I dismissed this as something for small children when I first saw it. I had to reconsider after seeing a YouTube video discussing the characters. I'm glad I did because this was just wonderful.

I tend to think of it as a puzzle game because catching the different bugsnax involves figuring out which tools to use. The visuals and audio are super adorable. The characters are a very strong point. They have different opinions and perspectives, and they have very realistic disagreements with each other and part of the enjoyment is seeing them develop as people by working through their issues. It is quite wholesome. Its really fantastic overall.

bug
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
41.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 31 aout 2023
The moment I tried this game out on my fiance's PS5, I fell in love with it. It very quickly became sort of a comfort game for me. If I'm feeling depressed or overwhelmed, I pay this game. I didn't 100% this game just for kicks, I did that because of just how much I love the experience this game offers. It's also just plain adorable, the snax are all designed and named perfectly, the characters and their stories are interesting to learn, and the amount of stuff to do for what seems like a simple game is refreshing. Highly highly recommend if you want something super chill to play, and of course if you like cute creatures. 10/10 highly recommend for Bunger alone.
 
MakaroniNoodles
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
41.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 aout 2023
I like hardcore survival games, so this game is not the kind I'd usually pick up. Even still, I loved Bugsnax. This is the kind of game where you can play for hours, and then dream of it when you go to bed. This is one of my top 10s, and after I finished it, passed the remote to my girlfriend for her turn to play through. I'd really recommend this to all of my friends, no matter their genre preferences.

Bugsnax is a unique take on the monster-hunting genre. You collect monsters, called Bugsnax, that are essentially a combination of food + bug. Each bugsnax has unique ways to capture them, and most of them can be captured in more than one way. It's creative, chill, and it's easy to become invested in all the characters you meet.

This is the first game I have ever unlocked all the achievements for, and I wish I could relive the experience again. 10/10.
 
pushing pee
352 produits enregistrés

Recommandé
47.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2023
Produit reçu gratuitement

I got this game gifted and I thought at first it was really sweet. Cute art style! Silly little food bugs! Cheery music! And all of that still holds up, of course. But I was not expecting how truly charming and well written the characters are or how interesting and amazing the plot is. It had really nicely done puzzles, beautiful locations (always amazed at the sky in this game) and so much to explore. I may have finished the game, but I'm definitely replaying it just for how fun and interesting the world of Bugsnax is

Wumbus if ur out there, you're the only one ever
