Évaluation publiée le 14 aout 2023
At first I thought this game was for children and nothing more but I still wanted to play it so I can relive my childhood of playing Pokémon. The joy on my face when I realised it was much more than that, was unspoken of.

I also love the mechanics and the idea of the traps being used in so many different ways, the story is entertaining to say the least and the interactions with the NPC’s always manage to make me burst out laughing.

I just can’t recommend this wonderful, enjoying and surprisingly dark game more than I already have.

0kash11
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
29.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 avril 2023
I can safely recommend this amazing game after almost 30 hours of gameplay, 100%ing the game, and 100%ing the achievements! ♥
I will admit, it may not be for everybody, but that goes for any game honestly.
♥ Bugsnax is basically Pokemon Lite (No Random encounters or RPG fights), the goal is to "Catch 'Em All!", and as someone who never had the patience to do that in any Pokemon game, it was SO much easier to do it in Bugsnax. Especially because many of the Main and Mail Quests help you work towards that goal.
♥ The story is simple but efficient, but by no means did I find it to be a short experience, especially if you complete all the Main and Mail Quests.
♥ The comedy is somehow top tier, I found myself laughing at just about every joke, even some of the stuff that wasn't meant to be funny.
♥ The Grumpanati is Real
♥ I love the characters, and I love that each of them got to develop through the game.
♥ This game feels like a kids game without treating you like a kid, the character relationships cover some deep topics and lessons, the gameplay is challenging but not impossible, but it's got that over all comfy feel that games like Stardew Valley or Animal Crossing have.

♥ TLDR; It's Good Soup ♥

Évaluation publiée le 7 avril 2023
This feels casual, relaxing, fun and engaging, but this adventure has some serious and relatable undertones.

It is full of heart and charm that you cannot wait to complete more quests! Characters may have different opinions on things between each other, but it is all about listening and understanding while cultivating relationships and helping them.

Deep down, everyone has a lovable side despite what the outside may show. Building strong relationships makes for a more fulfilling story.

Évaluation publiée le 31 mars 2023
This is unironically the most fun I've had with a game in a while, super comfy and satisfying to play. Catching all the bugsnax and doing the tasks doesn't really feel like a chore and, believe me, I never try to get all the achievements in most games exactly because of that. If anyone has any games quite like his tell me rn although I doubt they'll have such a charismatic rooster of characters

mS
176 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 janvier 2023
Bugsnax is a game you will enjoy

Bugsnax is a weird game that exceeds expectation in both gameplay and story. You start off as a journalist heading off to a mysterious island to interview a renowned explorer. When arriving you find everything in shambles- and it is up to you to solve both the mystery of bugsnax, and the villager’s problems.

Gameplay

The gameplay is what 3D pokemon should have been; you have these adorable silly creatures called bugsnax wandering around in these biomes doing their own thing. They have different behaviours that make them unique- and the objective is to catch them all. Villagers are hungry, and they crave the bugsnax. You have a variety of traps at your disposal to catch the, so each scenario might involve planning. There are puzzles, secrets, and criteria required to progress and discover more.

Difficulty

That being said, the game isn’t much difficult; there is no health, nor can you really die- or lose. Some of the bugsnax requires moderate critical thinking skills, but for the most part things are simple tasks. This shouldn’t discourage you though; the game makes up for it by pulling you into the story and compelling you to solve the mystery. The difficulty isn’t important; fun is.

Story

A lot of the fun comes from the story itself. Each villager has their own brand of issues and quirks that you have to deal with. They fight with each other, argue, and over all just don’t get along. Most have a partner with them, which brings a lot more nuance to each relationship and what is required to solve it. Each has their own little storyline you follow, and through it you discover what their problems are, and resolve them as the plot progresses. This all becomes apparent in the end, however it might end. There is a lot more to the bugsnax than what you see on surface level. Everyone might all be goofy creatures in colourful environments, but there’s more too it than just that.

Design

The art direction is that of a silly generic children’s cartoon; everything is playful and absurd- and it all sets a comfortable safe tone. The bugsnax itself are a great example of terrifying body horror; every time a villager eats a bugsnax, part of their body is transformed to resemble that bugsnax. Despite that being unsettling, the villagers are seemingly unphased by it, and instead are optimistic and delighted by the sight of the arm becoming a pickle. This is the contrast; the fun carefree appearance is offset by the uncanny nature of the bugsnax- and how the villagers are handling it. They are completely enamoured by the result of them. You get use to it, as it just becomes normalized as you hop around each area catching creatures to the music.

Music

I cannot really say anything too special about the music; in a way it has its charm, but it’s honestly long and drawn out- it’s like a modern 1950s grocery store music that just becomes a part of the ambiance. It is something you will just stop noticing, as it doesn’t really add much to the environments- aside from complimenting them slightly. The absolute most positive thing I can say about it is that it’s almost hypnotic; it’s this zen sort of melody that keeps things calm enough that you lose track of time.

Conclusion

Overall, I would consider this a great game that is worth playing. It’s a game that you should get comfy for and chill. Grab a controller, kick back, and go catch some snax.
 
muffs 900

Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2023
Now that I 100% Bugsnax I can safely say I loved it. Bugsnax made me feel like a child again, the style is cute and the story is unique. The jokes were funny and landed well, but the emotional moments and the ending still made me feel things. You'd think you'd get bored very fast but no! With every area the game brings something new and exciting, and there's multiple puzzles that were fun to do and didn't feel stale or repetitive. Overall, I really enjoyed it and I don't regret buying it :)

IT'S THE DEVELOPERS I SWEAR!! I just happen to be a very evil modifier MYSELF!!! ;) And after 100%ing the game, the joy and utterly splendiferous passion to keep traversing through the wonderfully abundant rivers of flavour falls, the beauteous snowy trees of the dusky pinehill forest, or the cavernous vast desert of the scorching gorge are all enjoyable and they never release stupendous grip on good utility, low expectations and specified hints for those who need it involving catching specific snaxs, such as telling you what type of sauce they enjoy most... IF YOU DARE to face the doomful exploration of the marauding BUGSNAX 100 TIMES… Muahahahahaha!! ;) These all make internal tracking through the foreign depths of new and beautiful environments seamless, even though quite at first as you traverse, converse, unlock, discover and capture using a plethora of skills and traps that truly make this game worthwhile, especially the ones where you frantically let yourself fall captive to the undeniably groovy music and DANCE THE NIGHT AWAY!!! ;) *Intensive music plays dramatically!!!!*

dunk
19 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
24.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 décembre 2022
One of the most charming, albeit weird, games out there. Bugsnax is a puzzle a la creature collector game full of memorable moments, story and game-play wise.

The loop of capturing 'snax and feeding them to townsfolk to make them ugly remained addictive and humorous across my entire play through. I raised many eyebrows when imitating the sounds of my favorite 'snax while on call with friends, and felt subsequently insane explaining the game to the uninitiated.

Heavily recommend / 10
 
Ocean
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 décembre 2022
This game caught me off guard, I tried it out on Game Pass out of curiosity since I had seen the reveal trailer and thought it was weird as hell. But hey, I said "Why not?" the art style looks good, and if it runs, controls and sounds well, it might be a fun time catching these things almost like if it's Animal Crossing.

Buddy, this game has some CHARM. Likeable characters, a soundtrack that VIBES, and a gameplay loop that hooks you.
I genuinely meant to just try it out for a few minutes but ended up playing it for several hours, didn't get enough sleep for work the next day, so I was drowsy the whole time. Even then, I felt it was worth it. The game was just fun, man.

I'd say give it a shot, it's one of those games that you'll realize within the first hour if you like it or not, so if you don't you can just refund it. I'm actually kind of shocked this is only $24.99. When I saw it revealed on the Sony State of Play, I thought it was going to be one of those games that stays at $60 for a long while.

TL;DR The game has a ton of charm and is very enjoyable. For only $25 it's a steal. Try it out - if you don't like it within the first 2 hours you can refund it, but you should really try to enjoy it since I think the developers did a great job here and I'd like for them to continue this.

The monster-catching mechanic is pretty fun to mess around and experiment with. It's a lot more active than something like Pokemon, so it's also a lot more exciting. The story is decent, but nothing too exciting, but it kept me entertained throughout the whole duration of the game. The music is also average, but I don't think that ruined the experience.

Boog
85 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 aout 2022
The first game ever i bought because of the discovery queue here on steam. The art style looked interesting, the reviews here on steam as well as on youtube etc were looking promising, therefore i gave the game a try.

And oh boy, it was such a fun ride. For about 21 hours to get all achievements i enjoyed almost every minute (except the times you get pushed around by the Bungers :D ). Not only is the art style fantastic, the gameplay, writing and sound design is amazing as well. Never boring, punishing or too difficult. The gameplay mechanics are perfect and nothing was just a gimmick. Missions never became obsolete, because the storytelling made every mission interesting. And the whole game ran without any issues or bugs (well there a bugsnax in the game).

It's definitely not a game for kids. The topics which the game touches ranging from relation ship issues, mental health to climate related topics. At the start of the game it's pretty delightful, but the story is becoming more and more darker and sinner towards the end. That doesn't mean though, that from time to time you laugh about the jokes the grumpus are making or the wonderful design of the bugsnax. Or let's say: If your kid under a certain age want to play this game, then make sure to watch your kid every now and then.

I suck in writing reviews, but i want to add my two extremely positive cents to this game, so maybe you are more willing to give this game a chance. It's definitely worth the full price (even though i got it while on sale) and i really hope for a sequel! The cliffhanger at the end let it look like that at least.

Bunga Bunga!
 
fluffy_-_
270 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 aout 2022
The spiritual successor to Viva Pinata (in my opinion)

Honestly I'm feeling like a 7/10 on the achievement scale - mostly completion based, but there are some things you wouldn't naturally do, and none of it was all that difficult. There was one single achievement I would describe as a 'grind,' but it was made more annoying by how little variety there really is in content.

About 60% of my playtime with this was done in one sitting like 5 minutes ago so I feel like now I could write a dissertation on every aspect of this game. But I won't do that.

This game is definitely 'right up my alley' because of the art style and the funny names and the lighthearted-ness, and while yes, I would recommend it purely as a Viva Pinata-esque collectathon/town manager, just about every remaining part of this falls pretty short for me. There were a LOT of moments where I thought "oh.. that's it?" as something would get revealed. A lot of pretty confusing choices, purely from a design standpoint.

I liked it for what it was, but wish there was something more substantial there at the end of the day - which the game itself certainly tries to convince you there is. But then there was a Kero Kero Bonito song during the credits and I forgot all my problems with it so we good

Évaluation publiée le 3 aout 2022
I bought this game all based off of one person suggesting how much of a masterpiece a game like bugsnax is. The whole day can go by just by logging on to catch a few bugsnax. The main story is absolutely phenomenal, and there are still many other side stories to do on the side. As a completionist of this game, I would still play it over again, and would even attempt to speedrun it. This game does not get the credibility it deserves, and I would personally rate it a solid minions movie/10

youseemeashie
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
32.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2022
better lgbt+ representation than the entire disney franchise catalogue

No, but seriously, Bugsnax is a charming, funny, delightfully well-made game. It has a great sense of humour, and a surprisingly deep cast of muppet-style characters, including the aforementioned LGBT+ representation (which was honestly incredibly refreshing, poignant, and all around wholesome). The story is well written, with mysterious twists as to the true nature of the bugsnax, set in a wacky, colourful world with plenty of secrets to uncover. The bugsnax are so well crafted, so creative, and collecting them definitely appeals to my gotta-catch-'em-all nature. There are plenty of sidequests and challenges to keep a completionist busy, and the gadgets and physics powering the game make for some genuinely surprising and funny moments, watching the bugsnax interact with each other and the cast.

I wasn't expecting this game to be as good as it is. It's clearly a labour of love and a lot of good humour, hard work, and genuine fun, which makes for a really lovely game experience. I only wish there was more. The story and lore put forth in the game leave many mysteries unsolved and much room for another visit to the world the developers have created. I'd absolutely love to see a sequel one day - it's rare to play a game with so much heart and humour, and strawberries with googly eyes.
 
sceptredisle
100 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
17.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2022
In Bugsnax you play as a journalist muppet who captures sub-sentient organisms that move like animals and look & taste like food, but are widely acknowledged to be something else entirely. This is not cause for concern.

If you like creature collectors, then this one comes with some fairly unique mechanics in the genre. Some snax are captured by simply setting a trap and lying in wait, others must be stunned and then scooped up, and some require you to lead one snak to another via a trail of sauce (bait) and cause them to collide or have one grab the other to stun.
Well I found it unique anyway, given that so many games in the genre are turn-based games or employ a simple net/vacuum approach.

A lot of work was put into the story, which is somewhat narrative-focused and largely character-driven. There's no reason to not do all of the side quests (it's a decent chunk of the content). It's got some cool twists and character moments. There's also the new Steam-launch DLC. I won't say much to stay clear of spoilers.

Overall the game is a purely for-fun experience. There's no threat of progress loss or death even during the boss fights. I'd say it respects the player's time. Will take ~10-12 hours to do just about all of the content. I went for 100% completion, which took a little longer. Good game.
 
Echonaut

This game extremely clever and very fun. Every bugsnax is like a mini puzzle to figure out how to catch and almost all the characters are very interesting. JoeBurger360
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
16.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 juin 2022
At its core, Bugsnax is a casual and relaxing exploration game. The gameplay loop consists of exploring new biomes, catching new and unique bugsnax, and interacting with the villagers of Snaktooth Island (which was the highlight of the game for me). All characters are memorable and unique in their own ways and the soundtrack is surprisingly great.

Though the 'psychological horror' tag on the store page may seem like a joke, there are some dark and creepy moments sprinkled throughout the story for such a lighthearted looking game, though nothing truly terrifying.

Overall, I'd definitely recommend giving Bugsnax a chance if you enjoyed games like Slime Rancher or are looking for a fun casual exploration game.
 
Eazy-E
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 juin 2022
It's fine.

The gameplay if fine, the characters are fine, the bugsnax are charming, the art direction is good, every bossfight is complete misery.

It's just fine. Solid 7/10. I like to try and full clear games from time to time and I prefer games that don't ask me to do anything terribly difficult or annoying, so this one qualifies for that pretty handily. You can easily do worse than this*

*provided that your definition of "full clear" is getting all the achievements. If you want to do all the side content then it gets very obnoxious and unrewarding very quickly with the letter quests. I highly advise doing the bare minimum in that department.

Évaluation publiée le 30 mai 2022
10/10 I have this game on Playstation, PC, and Steam because this game has easily became a top 5 fav!

Bugsnax is such a simple clever concept its remarkable beautiful yet cutesy Graphics is pleasing and comforting. Easily the evolution creature Collectathon games should be while not open world its unique and themed Levels with special bugsnax fill the land truly making the world feel natural and alive.

The bugsnax are clever and amazingly designed while some are clones such as shishkabug and instabug being antlike Snaks the designs and locations make the bugnax feel related rather then Copys. The Unique and Puzzling ways to catch and find Bugnax can range from Easy to Tricky and sometimes you unnecessarily make it more difficult then it is. being able to change Grumpuses into Snax is a fun yet creepy form of Customisation you can make all sorts of Variants and combinations.

Now the Story is the most amazing thing about this game with a wide range of characters with unique personalities and backstories. while sometimes border lining on Psychological Horror you will most likely relate to one of the characters struggles and the fact Lgbtq+ Representation is just in the game without the need to be Announced or Explained should be the new Norm for game titles and how the story tackles Mental Issues is serious and self aware without making fun on these communities.

I could not recommend this game more what a unique experience I had in this game and not only do i look forward to a Bugnax 2 Im also excited to see what Young Horses will do next even if your not a fan of Creature Collectathon Bugsnax is definitely my go to recommendation for friends!
 
MotherOfFairies

2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
1
Recommandé
80.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 mai 2022
НЕПОМЕЧЕНЫЕ СПОЙЛЕРЫ АЛЁРТ!
Ну что же. Спустя 80 часов я прошёл игру. (Да это много, но об этом позже.) И боже как же мне она
понравилась. Наткнулся я на неё случайно, во время похождений за осьминога, я задумался, а выпускали ли создатели ещё какие-то игры, так зайдя на страницу я увидел "Багснакс" который должен был выйти весной. Ещё по первому трейлеру я понял, что игра должна быть отличной и добавил в список желаемого, знаете я ничуть не пожалел от покупки.
Итак про что же сама игра? Тут всё довольно просто, взяли концепт Покемонов и добавили к нему "Облачно, возможны осадки в виде фрикаделек" (В обоих случаях сходство очевидно, если даже дополнение называется "Остров большенямок" ну очевидно отсылка на остров больших покемонов).
Ходишь по локациям, ловишь самые разнообразные живые продукты, помогаешь жителям островка, спасаешь мир от древнего зла... Погодите, чаво?
Вот тут, как мне кажется, и раскрывается главная фишка игры. Игра небольшими намёками всячески намекает, что это не совсем дружелюбный остров. (Да и метка психологический хоррор в стиме не просто так стоит.) Какие-то непонятные скелеты, пропажа главы экспедиции, рисунки жертвоприношений, персонажи которые расказывают жуткие истории про монстров прячущихся по ночам. Это точно детская игра?
Я думаю, что нет. За обманчиво-милой оболочкой скрывается довольно жуткая поднаготная. (И кстати я сам себе весь сюжет в начале игры проспойлерил, спасибо достижениям.)
Что мне действительно понравилось в игре, (Ну кроме жуконямок естесна), это персонажи. Их не много, но это даже к лучшему, легче всех запомнить. Наблюдать за их взаимоотношениями, и помогать в решении проблем, довольно интересно.
Самое неприятное в игре, это конечно баги. И я во время прохождения хапанул их не мало. Вылеты, ошибки, провалы под текстуры, пропадающие ловушки, в один момент я не мог поймать Глазунка, он почему то всега выбирался из ловушки, или вместо него ловился Пицц-бомбарир, а их на карте вообще не было)). Но наверное 2 самых неприятных момента, это загрузка локации "Хрумбург". (Нет серьёзно я мог загружаться в город, от 5 до 30 минут, что как бы дохрена, а после этого мог ещё и вылет следовать.) И потеря сохранения после вылета игры, я наиграв 33 часа, зашёл в игру и не нашёл своего сейва, а файл вообще закораптился, ну прошёл ведь всё-таки))).
Я считаю, что Багснакс, это действительно хорошая игра, и все кому нравится, что-либо коллекционировать, размышлять над загадками и пытаться понять все повороты сюжета, обязательно стоит попробовать её.
Моя личная оценка игре: 8/10 только из-за вылетов. Всем удачи. Bunger!
 
MrsX2
284 produits enregistrés
2
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 mai 2022
Honestly I was skeptical about Bugsnax, when it was announced as one of the first PS5 games. It felt overhyped from the start, and it didn't seem like a next gen game. Frankly, I thought all the Grumps looked like Minions 2.0 as well.

HOWEVER! After folks, streamers and your grandma had played it and had a good time, my curiosity peaked. I waited until it got released on Steam and then went absolutely ham. Least to say I'm having an enjoyable time! TL;DR at the bottom.

---

Positive
+ Art Style & Environments
Colours are poppin', each environment is based on a particular biome. The 2D elements are also simple 'n cute, think like Slime Rancher. It can be a bit tedious to go back and forth between areas though, especially as you do the sidequests for everybody. And it was at the 10 hour mark, I discovered there was a fast travel mechanic. Good job.

+ The Snax
They look so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ stupid, but it's stupid in a lovable way. There's a good amount of unique Snax, but also variations, like a different flavour. Also, you can put hats on the ones you donated to the farm. This is what real gamers want.

+ I'm A Plastic Surgeon: The Game
One of the mechanics is that you can modify the look of the NPCs by feeding them Bugsnax. At some point, you can customise every single body part, and also decide what food appears there. You like customising? You like playing dollhouse with your Barbies? You want to un-minionify the Grumps? Become a plastic food surgeon, and inject those sweet ol' nutrients in your pals to permanently turn them into bread.

+ Catching Critters
S'good, s'chill, it's silly. You catch walking food with your different tools at disposal- And sometimes it becomes like a little puzzle, because you gotta combine tools to catch that godforsaken donut. There's definitely a gotta catch 'em all feel, especially since 99% of (side)quests ask you to fetch some.

+ Puzzles
While most of the puzzles were easy to figure out, sometimes there is a puzzle that you gotta think about for a sec. This can be an environmental puzzle, or even a puzzle to catch the wretched sushi fish. It's fine, I imagine it'd be fun to play with your kid as a parent.

+ Sound Effects & Music
Silly and positively vibing, my guy.

---

Neutral
/ Story
The story is about discovering what Bugsnax are, while finding the One True Explorer Elizabeth Megafig. Megafig, you read that correctly, everybody has a name like Minky McSnugglesnoot. It's simple and nothing deep. Most of what you'll be doing is fulfilling everybody's wishes so they come back to Snaxburg, and then stay in Snaxburg.

/ The DLC Introduction
In my experience, I got to the DLC pretty late. It's pretty much 'endgame' when it happens, as it's introduced through the last sidequests of a few NPCs. I'm personally not really a fan of DLC being introduced this late, but, hey, at least I got to look at a real Big Bunger.

/ No One Gets The ♥♥♥♥ Along: Sidequest Edition
Me, the journalist, should've totally knitted a ginormous sweater that said 'get the ♥♥♥♥ along everybody!' and slammed every NPC into it. There's Snax drama, there's high school drama, there's gay drama, all kinds of drama you can think of, it exists.

Most if not all of it, is shown through the sidequests. Granted, it gives the NPCs more personalities and relationships, but hoo boy, that was some tea to digest. It felt like it was drama left and right, like damn just hug it out! Unless. You know. They're supposed to be grumpy because they're GRUMPuses, lmao.

---

Negative
— Controls Tad Clunky
It's mainly the tool selection wheel, it doesn't always work smoothly with controller at least. Or putting down the tools exactly where you want to. While it wasn't an unworkable mess, there were times some Cheeto escaped because of switching between many tools.

— I Got Stickbugged
I should've seen this coming.

---

TL;DR:
Stupid but lovable food creatures at your disposal to catch, while forcing everybody to get the ♥♥♥♥ along. Silly adventure for some good fun- Buy it if you like the catching 'em all mechanic, or you want to bond with your kid/cousin/grandchild/pasta dish/whatever.
 
Syrinq
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé

Gameplay is super fun and encourages creativity in how you approach each bugsnax. It's a super charming game and I have completely fallen in love with the world of Bugsnax. It's also surprisingly dark...

ChristopherLry
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
75.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 mai 2022
spoiler-free review!

id like to preface this by saying i never write reviews but i felt obligated to here as this is one of my favorite games of all time. the devs have done an incredible job on this game and the content update is no exception.

i played through bugsnax when it first released, and just finished my second 100% playthrough on steam. this game has been on my mind since launch, i desperately wanted it on steam for the achievement hunting and oh boy was it worth getting a second time! i would have played through again despite the update, but i was pleasantly surprised by the amount of content that has been added since initial launch. if youre a completionist like me, the update will bring you many more hours of gameplay with collecting things and new challenges presented to you. there are some cute cosmetic aspects as well that i really enjoyed playing with. not to mention how much lore they added! there is a ton of lore and character development squeezed into the update, it was incredibly satisfying connecting the dots and theorizing things as i played through with friends. we were all very happy to stumble upon the new worldbuilding; it really put the cherry on top of an already amazing game.

if youve played this game before, enjoyed it, and havent experienced the new content yet, id say its definitely worth getting a second time -- especially if youd like to support the devs.
if youve never played, but you like creature collection games and quirky little worlds, definitely give it a shot!!

10/10 and i recommend this game to everyone. cant wait to revisit it again next year!

Évaluation publiée le 9 mai 2022
Amazing game. I 100% recommend if you're into collectathons. If not, still give it a chance, you might like it. It has a great story/lore, great writing, great visuals, a lot of playtime, a great soundtrack by Seth Parker, and great designs. You've hit it out of the park again Young Horses.

My only criticisms is that there aren't achievements for the secret bugsnack (who is my favorite), getting all the hats, and for doing all the letters.

Other then that, amazing game. 10/10, best psychological horror I've ever played.

Évaluation publiée le 4 mai 2022
Unironically a great time. The gameplay is sweet and fun, not too easy but makes you think a little. The characters are enjoyable and well written, they are definitely very flawed individuals, but part of the fun is learning about them and why they came to the island. They're flaws and quirks make them fun to follow around and learn about.

The Bugsnax are adorable and confusing.
I can confidently say getting every achievement and 100% the game for the most part was a very relaxed and enjoyable experience. ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ BUGSNAX IS THE ♥♥♥♥ BRO

Omne Vivum Ex Bugsnax.

MindyDragon
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
2
Recommandé
15.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2022
I LOVE BUGSNAX!! I don't play too many games, but for people who are pretty new to gaming or like creature collection games, I would HIGHLY recommend they start here. The tools are easy to learn, there's a fun, heart-warming plot, and it's always fun coming up with different ways to catch these dubious little creatures. I didn't think I'd fall in love with these strange muppet looking characters, but I did. It feels like Slime Rancher, just a little less lonely :) Great game, I can't wait for more updates.
 
Capri._.Sunnn1007
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2022
My second time buying this game and completely worth it!
YOU CAN PET THE SNAXS NOW! 10/10 best addition ever, now I can give bunger and pinkle all the pets <3
Anyway, I originally bought this game on EG over a year ago, played through the whole thing and fell in love. I've been eyeballing this steam release since it was announced and I'm so happy to play it again. Honestly I love every aspect of this game so much that writing it all out is kind of pointless (and would be a damn novel). The visuals are cartoony yet beautiful and the sound track is just... *chefs kiss*. The gameplay is so unique and engaging that once you get a handle on the various ways to catch bug snaxs it becomes quite addictive. An absolute bonus compared to the EG release is all the new free content! I was so surprised to see that we finally get our own hut and can decorate it!! I love all the little side- side quests to collect new furniture while simultaneously adding more to do than just the regular side quests and story. Speaking of, both are really entertaining and pretty funny at times too. The ending is amazing and I will happily 100% this game.
Overall, if it looks interesting enough, why not give it a try? :)

TLDR;
Great game that you should definitely give a shot...worst case you don't like it (sorry for hyping it, chief.) and can refund it in the two hours!
 
Certified Dumbass

Play Bugsnax!

Recommandé
21.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 novembre 2022
Went into this for the bunger joke. Played through it and was overwhelmingly surprised at the amount of good dialogue and lore in the game. The gameplay mechanics didn't get repetitive despite there being limited things you CAN do. The music was feel-good and I didn't feel the need to mute it and put on Spotify like I usually would.
By the end of the game, I was captivated. I got all the achievements, did all I felt I could (besides EVERY mail quest) and am now waiting and hoping for a sequel.
10/10

As a game tagged with "psychological horror," I expected to be more scared. Instead, I got a nice little game where you catch bugsnax with a few spooky elements. The game is fine but it's really not as scary or mind-break-y as everyone made it out to be. The DLC dragged on a bit, but otherwise it was a solid game.

This was an unexpected delight. Fun graphics, inventive world/creature ideas, and engaging personalities in the people you meet. Honestly, I didn't put it down until I had 100%-ed both the original game and the DLC. Genuinely haven't had that much of a focus on a game since I was a kid.
 
LynxOnSmoothies
346 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
27.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 avril 2023
I just finished playing this game with my partner, and it's the most fun we've had playing a game together. The characters are so charming and we couldn't stop laughing throughout most of the dialogue. The story and quest lines were far more detailed and captivating than I expected just having watched the trailer, and it's a surprising combination of cartoonish body horror and heartfelt community-building adventures. It certainly helps you connect with all the NPCs when you can custom design their flesh to be whatever combination of monstrous insect-food hybrids you deem most fitting. 100% completing this game has left a hole in my gaming heart that I don't know if I can fill anytime soon.

Мимир
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
20.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 décembre 2022
A weird adventure with a bunch muppet-like creatures on an island full of living snacks with googly eyes. The game itself is an action adventure with barely any violence where you explore the island's various regions, find creative ways to trap the snacks, and socialize with the island's denizens, each an interesting person, troubled in their own way, with their own reason to be here.
While the "horror" tag is a bit excessive, the game does feature some weird and creepy stuff, starting with the fact that eating a bugsnack makes a character's body change, and going even weirder from there. The characters' stories go into some dark places too, despite their funny appearance. Overall, the story shows way more depth than one could expect from the game's visual style.
Special kudos to the developers for the amount and quality of queer representation. While there are no romances for the player character, the game's story is centered around an amazing lesbian couple (consisting of a walrus-like muppet and an egg-like muppet, but still). Two male denizens' storyline has them slowly figure out their relationship in a really sweet way. One of characters is nonbinary, too. Nobody bats an eye on that, making the game's world feel wholesome and welcoming.
 
thainen
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Hux-A7-13's Malewife
170 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
0.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 novembre 2022
Несмотря на хайп и мемы, игра довольно веселая. Головоломки простые, но местами можно задержатся из за багов (на уровне с бургерами, сам бургер застрял под деревом). Хорошее управление, графика легкая на глаз. Озвучка персонажей, смешные звуки итд итп все есть. Музыка местами однообразная, пришлось глушить на минимум. Игра напоминает старые детские игры, типа "Рога и Копыта", "Рататуй", "Шрек" - короче есть в этом что то, но в плане сюжета и механики, конечно Bugsnax совсем другой фрукт. Лучший "психологический хоррор" 2022.

27.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 novembre 2022
Its been a while since I've had an experience such as this, the gameplay is simple yet engaging and fun, and the story is what makes this game so great, the characters have so much depth, they are lovable and feel rather realistic and relatable. If your looking for a casual and relaxing feel good experience I highly recommend this game.

Pank!
157 produits enregistrés
0
4 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
39.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 octobre 2022
I've been watching things for this game for a long while, and after a long while I have finally found a way to get it for myself! Its a lovely game, really. Gotta love the LGBTQ+ representation, and the fact that you can still play after completing all side quests, main quests, Snaktooth and Broken Tooth! It has nice characters, and a play on the protagonist character I haven't really ever seen. Instead of taking care of everyone's problems and turning the island into the perfect paradise, you help the characters realize what their problems are and point them in the right direction to possibly do better. This game is just so hard to put down, and plus instead of a laid out story that you are expected to follow there's a open ended experience. You can decide whether or not to carry on your game farther, and go to Broken Tooth to experience new mechanics that are only seen there, and not in any other parts of the game. You can wreck relationships in there by killing one of the partners in the final battle too, if that's your kind of thing. I'm running out of words to say, because its so hard to describe how much I love this game!

Do not come to me if you read this review, played the game, and ended up stabbing an orange with a fork though. That's all you.
 
FemurStealur
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
40.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2022
I thought this game looked ridiculous, and it kind of is. But that plays to its strengths.

Amusing, heart-warming, and inventive. I love how you can catch bugsnax with a variety of tools, so you have a sense of discovery with every new encounter. Most every snax can be caught in multiple ways.

Most surprising is how good the writing is. It made me care about these silly-looking colorful meat blocks, which I honestly found off-putting at first. But god. What a breath of fresh air, and what a crazy ride.
 
Carivale
93 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
28.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 24 juillet 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

Bugsnax é um jogo que consegue ser fofo e ao mesmo tempo te deixar perturbado e provavelmente desconfortável (de um jeito bom), ele mistura personagens fofinhos que parecem ser uns muppets com comidinhas com olhinhos esbugalhados que repetem o próprio nome que nem um pokémon e ao mesmo tempo tem uma história preocupante que consegue escalar bastante. Os personagens são muito bem feitos, com personalidades e histórias interessantes e com dinâmicas curiosas entre si. A jogabilidade é muito interessante e faz com que muitas vezes você pense fora da caixa, além de você não poder morrer, o que faz com que seus desafios e preocupações sejam diferentes de um jogo com uma barra de vida pendendo sobre sua cabeça.

10/10 bunger

Rabid-Gentleman
91 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
26.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2022
Overall impression: 9.5 out of 10. A great buy at full price. Bugsnax is clever, fun, and well designed all the way through. It is one of the best all-round games I have played in a long time.

I will try to do a quick breakdown of what makes the game great without giving too many details. Players should dive in with little knowledge about the game and enjoy the ride.

Pros: Deft writing that makes you care for even the more distasteful characters. Catching bugs is fun and requires a bit of puzzle solving without being overly complex. The overarching story is great. Learning about the various characters, their relationships, and the secrets of the island and the bugsnax is a great trip.

♥♥♥♥: I am having to nitpick, since the game is so good. Some of the mail challenges are either too obtuse or require way too much running around the island. The bugsnax on the DLC island are clever, but they lean too much toward being annoying in how you have to puzzle out how to capture them while avoiding the other bugsnax in the area.

Conclusion: I read the great reviews and went in without spoilers. I am glad I did. Bugsnax is one of the best games I have played in a very long time.

Recommandé
22.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2022
kinda bug and kinda snack
try to catch 'em in your trap
feed somebody and you'll see
we are whatever we eat

a fun little physics-y puzzle-y collectathon game with solid character writing and absolutely nothing insidious going on. if you like collecting cute little food animal bugs and helping two muppets you barely know work out their marital communication issues, bugsnax is a great way to pass the time. the grumpuses are interesting and compellingly written, and what are hands for if not to surrender all mortal possessions to bunger? i played fairly casually and completed all the achievements/housing item side challenges in that time.

Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2022
I'm still in the process of playing the game so I'm going to review this the best I can, so please bare with me, Ahem,

Bunger bunger bunger bunger, bunger bunger, bunger, BUNGER!!!

Snakpod, SNAAAAAAAAKPOD,
Grapeskeeto, GRAPESKEEEEETO,

PINEANTULA!!!!

Long story short, this game is so original and one of my favorite games I have played this year. I look forward to the many hours I will put into this game and the many bugsnax I will put into the guts of many hungry grumps 😀

Update: 25 hours later, 100% completed, this game consumed my soul, I thought I was becoming a bugsnax. All around, good game, very fun, and addicting. I couldn't stop my wormy from wiggling the entire time I played.
 
Eric Andrew
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
15.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 28 novembre 2022
Absolutely INCREDIBLE game, not even joking. I went in expecting an easy game for kids with a simple plot, but it was far from that. The gameplay is extremely enjoyable, and catching all the different bugsnax is so satisfying! The plot is also much, much more intense then you would expect. It has a very unique atmosphere, I can't even explain it. It's such a cute looking game but with the looming sense that there's *something* up. As well, the voice acting is SO GOOD. All characters are voiced and they do a great job (and the people who voiced the bugsnax do great, too). 11/10. Definitely worth the price. You can even decorate your house!

I haven't wanted to play through a game immediately after beating it for a long time, probably not since the PS2 era, but I'm starting my 2nd run today after finishing everything yesterday. I absolutely recommend Bugsnax.

Évaluation publiée le 13 janvier 2023
Jeu qui au départ je ne m'attendais pas à ça (malheureusement dû à une mauvaise communication du jeu), car j'ai cru lancer un jeu pour enfant que l'on peut finir vite, mais il n'en est rien le jeu à une histoire énorme, des personnages différents haut en couleurs et ayant chacun leur particularité donnant un côté très intéressant au jeu, mêlé d'un système de jeu avec des choses varié à faire (petit défi et quêtes secondaires).
La direction artistique est drôle et en même temps très joyeuse voir parfois sérieuse.
Jeu à conseiller pour personnes appréciant un jeu avec une histoire importante et un système de jeu à chasse aux petits monstres.
 
Wolgulc
12,177 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
13.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2022
Where to even begin with this one. Yes, it's fun. Yes, it's well-designed. Yes, it has a nice amount of variety. It has good writing, proper pacing, fantastic sound design... and yes, it very much is psychological horror. This is not a joke.

I won't elaborate on that because of spoilers, but let me just ask you this: don't you think catching and eating cute little googly eyed creatures who clearly feel things like fear or anger is a little messed up? Well, let's just leave it at that.

What is this game even?
It definitely doesn't fit any common genre descriptions. My best attempt would be... story-driven open-world puzzle creature collectathon? For the most part, you'll be walking around one of the areas trying to catch some Bugsnax - either to fill that compendium, or to complete a quest. See, most quests are pretty much "catch X of Snak Y and put them in my mouth".

But no worries - these things are anything but fetch quests! Catching Bugsnax is both non-trivial and fun, and there's lots of different ways to catch them. Let me explain, if you'd like.

Catching some Snax
Every Bugsnak is a little puzzle. How do I catch it? Some are completely trivial - just use tool X - but as the game progresses, you'll find that many Snax have multiple layers of protection to them, and figuring out how to take them all down at once is where the fun really is.

Let's take a Snak I'll call "B". B is quite aggressive and will charge at you when you get close. If you manage to stun him somehow, you'll find that you still can't catch him, because he's covered in ice - trying will simply freeze you and your traps. So the puzzle becomes "how to unfreeze B?". But then when you do unfreeze him, he breaks into two smaller Snax... so what am I supposed to do? What indeed!

Some Snax are essentially versions of Snax you've already seen, but with one additional problem. You've seen Snak C? Get ready for Snak C... but on fire! It might sound lazy at first, but the added complexity keeps things fresh at all times.

And then of course there are Boss Bugsnax... these are multi-part encounters that are completely unique and have their own set of mechanics. They also often are at the end of one of many storylines. Oh yeah, the story!

The Story
Busgnax has the aesthetic of a kid's game, but it is anything but. The story is surprisingly deep and touches upon some dark elements of the human condition. I won't write what they are, find out yourself.

What I will write about are the characters. At first they appear as pretty stereotypical stock characters - a loser who thinks he's got power, a hostile farmer, a dumb jock bro... but then it turns out they're all quite interesting subversions of those tropes. For example, the dumb jock bro? He's anything but dumb, and when you ask him what's his job, he responds with "I lift". Weights? Yeah, that too, but generally anything that needs lifting. Weights, spirits, people when they're down... you know, it's a philosophy, bro.

Oh and that horror thing I mentioned earlier? Depending on how you play the game it can be mostly simply as an implication of certain things, but also it can get a little more... graphic. What I'm saying is I wouldn't recommend this to kids.

Conclusion
The game's good. Fun, pleasant, thought-provoking, all that stuff. And while I definitely enjoyed it a lot, I wouldn't call Bugsnax great. I'm not sure why that is. Something is missing. All elements of the game are top-notch, but they just kind of... refuse to come together. For me, at least.

Still, I definitely recommend it. If nothing else, it's a good time and the Bugsnax are cute.

Curator Page
 
Vitlök

0
Recommandé
10.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2022
Spoiler Review

Fun and charming game, each character has depth and their backstories aren't afraid to get serious and dark. I love the gameplay (although it started to get kind of boring near the end) and the main loop of catching bugsnax by figuring out different methods was really cool.

The famous twist for this game that everyone loves to talk about is really underwhelming, and left me wanting more - not in a good way. I kind of guessed that the bugsnax were gonna be evil, but still - I hoped the twist would be much darker as everyone compared this to Dont Hug Me Im Scared. Of course, since its a childrens game, it couldn't have actually done that.

Good game, underwhelming twist. 8.5/10

Manteca
146 produits enregistrés
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
13.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 décembre 2022
Produit reçu gratuitement

What surprised me most about this game was just the amount of heart it had. I enjoyed the moment to moment game-play of figuring out how to lure out different Bugsnax and dealing with things like how to lure a flying enemy or how to cool off a Bugsnax thats on fire and vice versa. But the characters were a real treat too! The voice cast is fantastic and, despite looking like Muppets, the issues they faced felt somewhat real. Makes you care more about them than just being an "interview subject" like how the game starts off. The interviews started turning into me wanting to know more about the character, rather than just getting a story. And even then the whole mystery around the island and Lizbert still compelled me to find out more! I enjoyed it from start to end.
 
Caped64
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
11.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 3 mai 2022
um jogo fofo e simples, com uma tematica simples. a trama nao é muito empolgante e com certeza nenhum pouco interessante. as missoes sao extremamente chatas e repetitivas, cansativas em geral. Demora muito para acontecer açao.
A gameplay em si é muito boa, voce pode fazer varios truques para pegar um bugsnax e existem varios deles, se voce curte coletar esse jogo é pra voce. Tem uma pegada de pokemon ja que voce pode tanto ver e capturar os bugsnax e marcá-los no journal.
É engraçado o quao criativo podem ser os moradores, voce pode mudá-los e transformá-los de varias maneiras.
É uma mistura de jogo infantil com um toque de "suspense" (isso se dá pra chamar de suspense), acho que nao precisaria estar na categoria terror psicologico mas realmente vai a calhar.
É um otimo jogo para jogar sozinho no tedio, mas depois de muito tempo fica chato e cansativo.

5/10
Eh, só serve pra passar o tempo mesmo. Pelo menos o visual é fofinho.

Maples6

3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
18.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 janvier 2023
This is a good game. Bugsnax makes me nostalgic for games from the PS1-2 era like Ape Escape, where you just buy a weird looking game that you know nothing about for a fair price & it ends up being the only thing you want to play for the next few days/weeks. All the content comes with the game & its got plenty to do. Lots of quests, places to explore, things to collect, challenges to do & cosmetics to customize. All in a genuinely quirky & charming package. I honestly wouldn't have thought this game would interest me as much as it did, especially as an adult, but it's the most simple fun I've had in a little while.

Elliot
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
58.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mai 2022
Kinda bug and kinda snack

Bugsnax is what I personally want from gaming; just devs having a great time making something fun, with a lot of heart. You can tell a lot of effort went into crafting the Grumpuses (Grumpus’?) personalities and the Snax. Each character brings a lot of, well, character, each bringing a different personality to the table and maintaining good (or intentionally bad!) chemistry with the other characters. (I personally believe in Snorpy and Chandlo supremacy :D)

THE SNAX:
The best part of the game. Goofy lil dudes with goofy little designs. I caught myself smiling many times upon seeing new snax for the first time. Also, shout out to the voice actors for the snax, because they sold those lines. Very goofy, and obscenely silly. I often think fondly of the sounds Bopsicle and Scoopy Banoopy make.

THE STORY:
You play as an investigative journalist who’s on a last ditch effort to save their job after receiving an invitation from Elizabert Megafig on Snacktooth Island. A bit of mystery, a bit of seriousness, a lot of fun ensues. Your job is to find out what is going on on the island, as well as finding out what happened to Elizabert. Without spoiling anything, do all the loyalty missions for your buds in snaxburg (why wouldn’t you? They’re your buds!) for the best and happiest ending.

Overall, this game is fantastic and if you’re looking for something short, sweet, with a lot of heart, buy it. I was not disappointed, and would gladly pay full price again.

⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢷⠾⠛⠂⢹⠀⠀⠀⢡⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠙⡇
 
Seedy
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
21.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2022


"Bugsnax" is great on almost all counts; it's hard to find fault with this gem. The gameplay, writing, character design and development, voice acting, and sound design are particularly outstanding. Heartfelt characters combined with fun, forgiving gameplay mechanics lead to a delightful first-person adventure in a colorful world. Players catch cute food/animal hybrids reminiscent of Pokemon and feed them to residents of the nearby town of Snaxburg, all while helping those same residents work through the problems they have with themselves and others in town.

The game also includes modern LGBT representation. The central story focuses around a lesbian couple in a realistic relationship with real relationship issues, there are several questlines that focus on another loving queer relationship in town, and the developers even included a separate non-binary mad scientist character.

While there are some mildly scary moments, the game is overwhelmingly a relaxing, family-friendly PG adventure and highly recommended for both kids and adults.
 
tobes
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
25.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 juillet 2022
Behind the game's basic premise of catching the titular creatures lies a brilliantly-paced story with plenty of intrigue and phenomenal character development. As the protagonist looks for Lizbert, the explorer that led the expedition to the island, they meet the other members of her team and work on reassembling their community, while piecing together clues to her wheareabouts.

Figuring out how to best use the traps to catch each of the 100+ species of Bugsnax is a rather rewarding experience, and the process of discovering their effects on fellow grumps is also amusing — mixing and matching different 'Snax allows for the creation of unique looks. As for the creatures themselves, their design is very creative and their Pokémon-like cries, although goofy in nature, are inherently fun.

All in all, I had a very enjoyable time playing Bugsnax, and I guarantee it's among the best games I've played this year so far. By taking your time tinkering with the game mechanics, running every single quest and errand, and solving every mystery, the game can be finished in around 20hs.

this game is surprisingly good. i initially bought it as a joke, and decided to give it a real shot. its such a fun game for almost no reason, great mechanics, great story. after completing the main story theres some post game content and free dlc, i loved it so much its one of the few games i decided to 100% (though theres no real indicator). i finished the main story about 16ish hours in, and spent the remainder of my time working toward 100%
 
xDuskii
0
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
14.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 avril 2022
It's been a quite awhile since Bugsnax first originally released and I spent the time waiting until it came onto steam, and WOW this game is astonishing and adorable. If you are a big fan of a mix of slime rancher and pokemon snap I highly recommend this!

Bugsnax is one of the very few games I put all my time into and finished in one sitting of 7.3 hours including quite a majority of the main game side quests. The voice acting is spot on, the gameplay is innovative and really makes you think outside of the box with your given gear, and the story. My lord the story, it is really really good, every character has their own stories that are told through their side quests and the main game. Additionally, the plot is very well paced, you can spend your time catching the Bugsnax that you want to catch before you progress, like bunger. Bunger is a precious bunger bean.

As for the game performance/game issue side of my interview I only noticed a minor stutter on only one side quest moment. That is all though performance wise, this game runs very well and the optimizations that you can do in the options is plentiful. As for game issues, one minor thing that happened while I was exploring I got stuck in one small spot and had to fast travel to a different area in order to get out, it didn't bother me much though, the load times are quick and fast as they can possibly be!

In conclusion, if you have thought about getting this game, please do! It's fun, charming, unique and innovative! I also want to finish off by encouraging getting the soundtrack, the soundtrack in the game is really good and it supports the Young Horses studio to allow them to make more games like this masterpiece.

I may give this an additional edit in the future after I go through the Isle of Bigsnax, for now though take care!

Honestly even if you just play to see all of the cute snax you'll have a good time.

KatCat
91 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1
Recommandé
37.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2022
Talkin' bout bugsnax~

The representation in this game is really well done. lgbt characters are obviously lgbt, but aren't highlighted and shoved into the players face as some kind of trophy or abnormality. no, instead, these characters are introduced the same way the rest are. They aren't any more significant than the others, which can be very normalizing for any young person playing the game.

Most movies, games, etc, treat lgbt+ characters as if they are unique, that it isn't common or normal to be part of that community- Many only include gay characters simply to say that they, in fact, included a gay character. This usually means that said character gets little to no screen time and is portrayed different than the others, pushing the idea that being lgbtqia+ is some kind of oddity, which is the opposite of normalization. its refreshing to see that this game doesn't do that,
 
Mable

Évaluation publiée le 11 novembre 2022
My favorite games include the Withcer 3, RDR2, and Bugsnax. Something my friends often tease me about. But it is literally so good the characters are so charming the plot is really good, like SO much better than I had anticipated, as long as you do the side quest and pay attention to all the lore and stuff it becomes so much more than cute lil bug monsters. But the great thing about this game is you get BOTH it's so worth it. Even at full price.

Évaluation publiée le 21 juillet 2022
I love this game. Seriously it's so full of charm and adorable characters where absolutely nothing goes wrong and everything is campy and cute. You may see fruit Bugsnax but the real Fruity thing here is this game gives BOTH great MLM AND WLW rep. Never in my wildest dreams did I expect a game with muppets is gonna be the game that finally gives me my Jock/Nerd MLM ship that I always wanted in media

Fun gameplay, great characters, adorable art style, lovely friendly story . 10/10 would recommend and feed all my loved ones Bugsnax again

Recommandé
19.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 janvier 2023
TLDR; 10/10. Many plot twists, amazing story, incredible character development.

This game was great! I LOVE it. Went into it blind, I love how you can see the characters change and develop over time. The visuals are stunning, the bugsnax are adorable! The story was really good, albeit a bit predictable. There was some easter eggs at the end of the credits, so maybe a Bugsnax 2 yeah? I hope so.

Évaluation publiée le 24 juin 2022
I've almost 100% the game the only thing i haven't finished is the mail quests and i have 3 left. This game is crazy, weird, and kinda disturbing. All the characters are well written, and has some fun intense moments. and by the end i had completely forgotten how funny the names sound. I would die for filbo.

also bunger
 
The Literal Concept Of Morality
151 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
32.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 octobre 2022
I have this game on every single system it comes out for; That's how good this game is. A wonderful creature collector game with adorable creatures and fun NPCs! If you like collection games, puzzle games, and love when you can See the love in the lore- you will LOVE this game!

It's so so so hard to put down this game! From the visuals to the lore, you'll be captivated right from the start! Lgbt+ rep in the form of little fuzzy fellas wasn't where I thought I'd find it, but I was happily startled to see it! This is an adorable game that will hold a special place in your heart for years to come and keep you coming back!

Tldr: Fantastic creature collection and puzzle game with cute little queer characters that finally have some godd*mn lore!!!

20.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 mai 2022
No this game isn't a joke, it's genuinely one of my new favorite games of all time. Come for the funny little creatures, stay for the fantastic character writing, voice work, soundtrack, and lore. It has Kirby plot escalation which I love it for but understand some might not, though plenty foreshadowing is present.
